FEP SDK API

Doxygen documentation

The complete Doxygen documentation can be found here fep3-sdk doxygen .

RPC Service

RPC Data Registry

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
    // returns a comma seperated list of all signal names coming in
    {
        "name": "getSignalInNames",
        "returns": "signal_name_1,signal_name_2"
    },

    // returns a comma seperated list of all signal names going out
    {
        "name": "getSignalOutNames",
        "returns": "signal_name_1,signal_name_2"
    },

    // retrieves the stream type for a given signal name
    // searches in the following order for signal by name
    // and returns the corresponding stream type if a signal is found:
    // * alias inputs
    // * alias outputs
    {
        "name": "getStreamType",
        "params": {
            "signal_name": "signal_name"
        },
        "returns": {
            "meta_type": "meta_type",
            "properties": {
                "names": "name_prop_1,name_prop_2,name_prop_3",
                "values": "value_prop_1,value_prop_2,value_prop_3",
                "types": "type_prop_1,type_prop_2,type_prop_3"
            }
        }
    }
 ]

RPC Clock Service

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
  // returns a comma seperated list of the names of all registered clocks
  {
    "name": "getClockNames",
    "returns": "name1,name2"
  },

  // returns the name of the current configured clock
  {
    "name": "getMainClockName",
    "returns": "name1"
  },

  // return the time in nano sec for the given clock
  // if clock_name is empty it will return the time of the current getCurrentClock
  // if the clock does not exist it will return "-1"
  {
    "name": "getTime",
    "params": {
      "clock_name": "name1"
    },
    "returns": "int64_time" //nanosec
  },
  // return the type of the current clock
  // continuous clock = 0
  // discrete clock = 1
  // if the clock does not exist it will return -1
  {
    "name": "getType",
    "params": {
        "clock_name": "name1"
    },
    "returns": 1 //the type continuous clock = 0,discrete clock = 1
  }
]

RPC Clock Sync Slave

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
  // sync time event to synchronize the time between timing master and slave
  // only applicable for clocks of type discrete
  {
    "name": "syncTimeEvent",
    "params": {
      "event_id": 1,
      "old_time": "int64_time",
      "new_time": "int64_time"
    },
    "returns": "int64_time" //nanosec
  }
]

RPC Clock Sync Master

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
    // register a Slave
    // for before/update/after events
    {
        "name": "registerSyncSlave",
        "params": {
            "slave_name": "name1",
            "event_id_flag": 1
        },
        "returns": 1
    },
    // unregister a Slave
    {
        "name": "unregisterSyncSlave",
        "params": {
            "slave_name": "name1"
        },
        "returns": 1
    },
    //
    {
        "name": "slaveSyncedEvent",
        "params": {
            "slave_name": "name1",
            "new_time": "int64_time"
        },
        "returns": 1 //nanosec
    },
    // get the clock sync master clock type
    {
        "name": "getMasterType",
        "returns": 1 //continuous = 0, discrete = 1 ... time update events are sent for discrete type only
    },
    // get the clock sync master time
    {
        "name": "getMasterTime",
        "returns": "int64_time" //nanosec
    }

]

RPC Configuration Service

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
    //lists available sub properties
    {
        "name": "getProperties",
        "params": {
            "property_path": "name"
        },
        "returns": "prop1,prop2"
    },

    //lists all available sub properties
    {
        "name": "getAllProperties",
        "params": {
            "property_path": "name"
        },
        "returns": "path/prop1,path/prop2,path/subpath/prop"
    },

    //gets information if a specific property exists
    {
        "name": "exists",
        "params": {
            "property_path": "name"
        },
        "returns": true
    },

    //gets the value of a specific property
    {
        "name": "getProperty",
        "params": {
            "property_path": "name"
        },
        "returns": {
            "value": "value",
            "type": "type"
        }
    },

    //sets a property of a named graph object
    {
        "name": "setProperty",
        "params": {
            "property_path": "name",
            "value": "value",
            "type": "type"
        },
        "returns": 0 // error code
    }
]

RPC Job Registry

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
  // returns a comma seperated list of the names of all registered jobs

  {
    "name": "getJobNames",
    "returns": "name1,name2"
  },

  // returns the job info for a specific job
  {
    "name": "getJobInfo",
    "params": {
      "job_name": "name1"
    },
    "returns": {
        "job_name" : "name1",
        "job_configuration": {
          "cycle_sim_time": "cycle_time",
          "delay_sim_time": "delay_time",
          "max_runtime_real_time": "max_runtime",
          "runtime_violation_strategy": "runtime_violation_strategy"
        }
      }
    }
]

RPC Logging Service

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
    {
        "name": "setLoggerFilter",
        "params": {
            "logger_name": "name",
            "severity": 0,
            "enable_sinks": "rpc,file,console"
        },
        "returns": 0 //sink creation error
    },
    //returns the current logging filter of the given loggername or filter
    {
        "name": "getLoggerFilter",
        "params": {
            "logger_name": "name"
        },
        "returns": {
            "severity": 0,
            "enable_sinks": "rpc,file,console"
        }
    },
    //lists all available logger names
    {
        "name": "getLoggers",
        "returns": "logger1,logger2,logger3"
    },
    //lists all available sinks
    {
        "name": "getSinks",
        "returns": "rpc,file,console"
    },
    //lists all available properties
    {
        "name": "getSinkProperties",
        "params": {
            "sink_name": "name"
        },
        "returns": "prop1,prop2"
    },
    //gets the value of a specific sink property
    {
        "name": "getSinkProperty",
        "params": {
            "sink_name": "name",
            "property_name": "property_name"
        },
        "returns": {
            "value": "value",
            "type": "type"
        }
    },
    //sets a property of sink property
    {
        "name": "setSinkProperty",
        "params": {
            "sink_name": "name",
            "property_name": "property_name",
            "value": "value",
            "type": "type"
        },
        "returns": 0 // error code
    }
]

RPC Participant Info

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
    // returns a comma seperated list of RPC services
    {
        "name": "getRPCServices",
        "returns": "service1;service2"
    },

    // returns the interface id of an RPC services
    {
        "name": "getRPCServiceIIDs",
        "params": {
            "rpc_service_name": "service1"
        },
        "returns": "iid1;iid2"
    },

    // retrieves the interface definition of the rpc components
    {
        "name": "getRPCServiceInterfaceDefinition",
        "params": {
            "rpc_service_name": "clock",
            "service_iid": "clock.iid"
        },
        "returns": "json"
    },

    // returns the name of the
    {
        "name": "getName",
        "returns": "participant_name"
    },

    // returns the current system name the participant is relying to
    {
        "name": "getSystemName",
        "returns": "name_of_system"
    },

    // returns the version of the participant
    {
        "name": "getFEPVersion",
        "returns": "version_string"
    }
]

RPC Scheduler Service

// Copyright @ 2021 VW Group. All rights reserved.
//
//     This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla
//     Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed
//     with this file, You can obtain one at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
//
// If it is not possible or desirable to put the notice in a particular file, then
// You may include the notice in a location (such as a LICENSE file in a
// relevant directory) where a recipient would be likely to look for such a notice.
//
// You may add additional accurate notices of copyright ownership.
[
  // returns a comma seperated list of names of all registered schedulers
  {
    "name": "getSchedulerNames",
    "returns": "name1,name2"
  },

  // returns the name of the current active clock
  {
    "name": "getActiveSchedulerName",
    "returns": "name1"
  }
]

Macros

Clock Service

FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CONFIG "clock"

The clock service main property tree entry node.

FEP3_MAIN_CLOCK_PROPERTY "main_clock"

The main clock configuration property name Use this to set the main clock by configuration.

FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE_PROPERTY "step_size"

Step size of the built-in discrete simulation time clock in nanoseconds.

FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR_PROPERTY "time_factor"

Factor at which discrete time steps of the built-in discrete simulation time clock pass compared to the system time.

A time factor of 2 means the discrete time step passes twice as fast compared to the system time. A time factor of 0,0 means no delay exists between discrete time steps.

FEP3_TIME_UPDATE_TIMEOUT_PROPERTY "time_update_timeout"

Timeout for sending time update events like timeUpdating, timeReset, etc.

to timing slaves. The timeout is applied per slave and update function.

FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_MAIN_CLOCK FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CONFIG "/" FEP3_MAIN_CLOCK_PROPERTY

The clock service main clock configuration node Use this to set the main clock by configuration.

FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CONFIG "/" FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE_PROPERTY

Step size of the built-in discrete simulation time clock in nanoseconds.

FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE_MIN_VALUE 1

Minimum value of the built-in ‘discrete simulation time clock’ step size property in nanoseconds.

FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE_MAX_VALUE fep3::Duration::max().count() / 1000

Maximum value of the built-in ‘discrete simulation time clock’ step size property in nanoseconds.

The value is chosen to allow 1000 simulation steps before reaching the hard limit of int64_t.

FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE_DEFAULT_VALUE 100000000

Default value of the built-in ‘discrete simulation time clock’ step size property in nanoseconds.

FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CONFIG "/" FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR_PROPERTY

Factor at which discrete time steps of the built-in discrete simulation time clock pass compared to the system time.

A time factor of 2 means the discrete time step passes twice as fast compared to the system time. A time factor of 0,0 means no delay exists between discrete time steps.

FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR_AFAP_VALUE 0.0

Value to configure the built-in ‘discrete simulation time clock’ time factor property to run in ‘As Fast As Possible’ mode.

FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR_DEFAULT_VALUE 1.0

Default value of the built-in ‘discrete simulation time clock’ time factor property.

FEP3_CLOCK_WALL_CLOCK_STEP_SIZE_MIN_VALUE 1

Minimum value of the built-in ‘discrete simulation time clock’ wall clock step size in nanoseconds.

The wall clock step size takes into account the FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE and the FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR. The configured step size may not be lower than this value after applying the time factor.

FEP3_CLOCK_WALL_CLOCK_STEP_SIZE_MAX_VALUE fep3::Duration::max().count() / 1000

Minimum value of the built-in ‘discrete simulation time clock’ wall clock step size in nanoseconds.

The wall clock step size takes into account the FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE and the FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR. The configured step size may not be lower than this value after applying the time factor. The value is chosen to allow 1000 simulation steps before reaching the hard limit of int64_t.

FEP3_CLOCK_LOCAL_SYSTEM_REAL_TIME "local_system_realtime"

Name of the clock service built-in clock to retrieve the current system time (continuous clock).

See

FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_MAIN_CLOCK

FEP3_CLOCK_LOCAL_SYSTEM_SIM_TIME "local_system_simtime"

Name of the clock service built-in clock to retrieve a simulated time (discrete clock).

The discrete clock may be configured using FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_STEP_SIZE_PROPERTY and FEP3_CLOCK_SIM_TIME_TIME_FACTOR_PROPERTY.

See

FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_MAIN_CLOCK

FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_TIME_UPDATE_TIMEOUT FEP3_CLOCK_SERVICE_CONFIG "/" FEP3_TIME_UPDATE_TIMEOUT_PROPERTY

Timeout for sending time update events like timeUpdating, timeReset, etc.

to timing slaves. The timeout is applied per slave and update function.

FEP3_TIME_UPDATE_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT_VALUE 5000000000

Default value of the timeout for sending time update events in namespace in nanoseconds.

Clock Sync Service

FEP3_CLOCKSYNC_SERVICE_CONFIG "clock_synchronization"

Name of the clock synchronization entry in configuration service.

FEP3_TIMING_MASTER_PROPERTY "timing_master"

Name of the property to set the timing master in the clock synchronization service.

FEP3_CLOCKSYNC_SERVICE_CONFIG_TIMING_MASTER FEP3_CLOCKSYNC_SERVICE_CONFIG "/" FEP3_TIMING_MASTER_PROPERTY

Full path of the property for the timing master to use.

FEP3_CLOCK_SLAVE_MASTER_ONDEMAND "slave_master_on_demand"

Name of the timing client continuous clock provided by the native synchronization service.

The clock periodically synchronizes its time with a given timing master. The period after which the synchronization occurs is configurable via FEP3_CLOCKSYNC_SERVICE_CONFIG_SLAVE_SYNC_CYCLE_TIME and defaults to FEP3_SLAVE_SYNC_CYCLE_TIME_DEFAULT_VALUE. The clock uses the Christian’s algorithm to interpolate the time during synchronization steps.

FEP3_CLOCK_SLAVE_MASTER_ONDEMAND_DISCRETE "slave_master_on_demand_discrete"

Name of the timing client discrete clock provided by the native synchronization service.

The clock receives time update events by a timing master which must be a discrete clock.

FEP3_SLAVE_SYNC_CYCLE_TIME_PROPERTY "sync_cycle_time"

Period at which the clock of the timing slave continuous clock synchronizes with the timing master.

Only relevant for timing slave configuration if the timing slave’s main clock is set to FEP3_CLOCK_SLAVE_MASTER_ONDEMAND. The timing slaves’s clock cyclically requests the current simulation time from the timing master. The duration in ns which has to pass between those time requests is configured by this property.

FEP3_CLOCKSYNC_SERVICE_CONFIG_SLAVE_SYNC_CYCLE_TIME FEP3_CLOCKSYNC_SERVICE_CONFIG "/" FEP3_SLAVE_SYNC_CYCLE_TIME_PROPERTY

Period at which the native timing client continuous clock synchronizes with the timing master.

Only relevant for timing client configuration if the timing client’s main clock is set to ‘slave_master_on_demand’. The timing client’s slave clock cyclically requests the current simulation time from the timing master. The duration in ns which has to pass between those time requests is configured by this property.

FEP3_SLAVE_SYNC_CYCLE_TIME_DEFAULT_VALUE 100000000

Default value of the built-in ‘slave_master_on_demand’ clock’s slave sync cycle time property in ns.

Scheduler Service

FEP3_SCHEDULER_SERVICE_CONFIG "scheduling"

Main property entry of the scheduling properties.

FEP3_SCHEDULER_PROPERTY "scheduler"

The scheduler configuration property name Use this to set the scheduler by configuration.

FEP3_SCHEDULER_SERVICE_SCHEDULER FEP3_SCHEDULER_SERVICE_CONFIG "/" FEP3_SCHEDULER_PROPERTY

The scheduler configuration property path to set up the scheduler to use.

FEP3_SCHEDULER_CLOCK_BASED "clock_based_scheduler"

Name of the native scheduler implementation.

Job Registry

FEP3_JOB_REGISTRY_CONFIG "job_registry"

Main property entry of the job registry properties.

FEP3_JOBS_PROPERTY "jobs"

The jobs node name Use this node to address specific job configuration nodes by path from inside the job registry configuration node.

FEP3_JOB_REGISTRY_JOBS FEP3_JOB_REGISTRY_CONFIG "/" FEP3_JOBS_PROPERTY

The jobs node Use this to address specific job configuration nodes by path.

FEP3_JOB_CYCLE_SIM_TIME_PROPERTY "cycle_sim_time"

Job entry cycle time configuration property Use this to access the cycle time configuration property of a specific job configuration entry.

FEP3_JOB_DELAY_SIM_TIME_PROPERTY "delay_sim_time"

Job entry delay time configuration property Use this to access the delay time configuration property of a specific job configuration entry.

FEP3_JOB_MAX_RUNTIME_REAL_TIME_PROPERTY "max_runtime_real_time"

Job entry max runtime configuration property Use this to access the max runtime configuration property of a specific job configuration entry.

FEP3_JOB_RUNTIME_VIOLATION_STRATEGY_PROPERTY "runtime_violation_strategy"

Job entry time violation strategy configuration property Use this to access the time violation strategy configuration property of a specific job configuration entry.

Data Registry

FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_CONFIG "data_registry"

The data registry main property tree entry node.

FEP3_MAPPING_CONFIGURATION_PROPERTY "mapping_configuration"

The mapping configuration property name Use this to set the mapping configuration with a single string from inside the data registry configuration node.

FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_MAPPING_CONFIGURATION FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_CONFIG "/" FEP3_MAPPING_CONFIGURATION_PROPERTY

The mapping configuration property node Use this to set the mapping configuration with a single string.

FEP3_MAPPING_CONFIGURATION_FILE_PATH_PROPERTY "mapping_configuration_file_path"

The mapping configuration file path property name Use this to set the mapping configuration with a file path from inside the data registry configuration node.

FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_MAPPING_CONFIGURATION_FILE_PATH FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_CONFIG "/" FEP3_MAPPING_CONFIGURATION_FILE_PATH_PROPERTY

The mapping configuration file path property node Use this to set the mapping configuration with a file path.

FEP3_SIGNAL_RENAMING_INPUT_CONFIGURATION_PROPERTY "renaming_input"

The input signal renaming configuration property name.

Use this to set the input signal renaming configuration with a single string from inside the data registry configuration node.

FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_SIGNAL_RENAMING_INPUT_CONFIGURATION FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_CONFIG "/" FEP3_SIGNAL_RENAMING_INPUT_CONFIGURATION_PROPERTY

The input signal renaming configuration property node.

Use this to set the input signal renaming configuration with a single string.

FEP3_SIGNAL_RENAMING_OUTPUT_CONFIGURATION_PROPERTY "renaming_output"

The output signal renaming configuration property name.

Use this to set the output signal renaming configuration with a single string from inside the data registry configuration node.

FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_SIGNAL_RENAMING_OUTPUT_CONFIGURATION FEP3_DATA_REGISTRY_CONFIG "/" FEP3_SIGNAL_RENAMING_OUTPUT_CONFIGURATION_PROPERTY

The output signal renaming configuration property node.

Use this to set the output signal renaming configuration with a single string.

Namespace fep3

namespace fep3

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace.

This file is generated by jsonrpcstub, DO NOT CHANGE IT MANUALLY!

FEP 3 SDK Library namespace.

Typedefs

using SystemAggregatedState = fep3::rpc::ParticipantState

The aggregated system state as participant state.

Functions

template<class interface_type>
interface_type *getComponent(const arya::IComponents &components)

extracting fep3::arya::getComponent() from version namespace

Return

interface_type* the valid interface pointer

Template Parameters

  • interface_type: the component interface looking for

Parameters

  • [in] components: the reference to the components

Return Value

  • nullptr: the interface was not found

System discoverSystem(std::string name, std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_DISCOVER_TIMEOUT)

discoverSystem discovers all participants which are added to the system named by name.

The default url will be taken which is provided by fep participant library.

It will use the default service bus discovery provided by the fep participant library

Return

Discovered system

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the system which is discovered

  • [in] timeout: (ms) timeout for remote request; has to be positive

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: throws if one of the discovered participants is not available

System discoverSystemByURL(std::string name, std::string discover_url, std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_DISCOVER_TIMEOUT)

discoverSystemByURL discovers all participants which are added to the system named by name which are discoverable on the given discover_url .

It will use the default service bus discovery provided by the fep participant library.

Return

Discovered system

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the system which is discovered

  • [in] discover_url: url where the systems can be discovered

  • [in] timeout: (ms) timeout for remote request; has to be positive

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: throws if one of the discovered participants is not available

std::vector<System> discoverAllSystems(std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_DISCOVER_TIMEOUT)

discoverAllSystems discovers all participants at all systems on the default discovery url.

The default url will be taken which is provided by fep participant library.

It will use the default service bus discovery provided by the fep participant library

Return

vector of discovered systems

Parameters

  • [in] timeout: (ms) timeout for remote request; has to be positive

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: throws if one of the discovered participants is not available (for filtering of standalone participants)

void preloadServiceBusPlugin()

Loads the service bus plugin.

std::vector<System> discoverAllSystemsByURL(std::string discover_url, std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_DISCOVER_TIMEOUT)

discoverAllSystemsByURL discovers all participants at all system which are discoverable on the given discover_url

It will use the default service bus discovery provided by the fep participant library.

Return

vector of discovered systems

Parameters

  • [in] discover_url: url where the systems can be discovered

  • [in] timeout: (ms) timeout for remote request; has to be positive

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: throws if one of the discovered participants is not available (for filtering of standalone participants)

class IEventMonitor
#include <event_monitor_intf.h>

Virtual class to implement FEP System Event Monitor, used with fep3::System::registerMonitoring.

Subclassed by EventMonitor

Public Functions

virtual ~IEventMonitor()

DTOR.

virtual void onLog(std::chrono::milliseconds log_time, LoggerSeverity severity_level, const std::string &participant_name, const std::string &logger_name, const std::string &message) = 0

Callback on log.

You will only retrieve log messages above the given fep::System::setSystemSeverityLevel

Parameters

  • [in] log_time: time of the log

  • [in] severity_level: severity level of the log

  • [in] participant_name: participant name (is empty on system category)

  • [in] logger_name: (usually the system, participant, component or element name and category)

  • [in] message: detailed message

class ISystemLogger
#include <system_logger_intf.h>

The system logger is an internal interfaces used within the ParticipantProxy It is the connection to the IEventMonitor set within the fep3::System class.

Each logging message within the ParticipantProxy which is part of a fep3::System will be forwarded to this interface.

Public Functions

virtual void log(const std::chrono::milliseconds &timestamp, LoggerSeverity level, const std::string &participant_name, const std::string &logger_name, const std::string &message) const = 0

logs a log message to the system logger.

Parameters

  • [in] timestamp: time value

  • [in] level: Level

  • [in] participant_name: The name of the participant

  • [in] logger_name: the name of the logger

  • [in] message: the message that will be forwarded

virtual void log(LoggerSeverity level, const std::string &participant_name, const std::string &logger_name, const std::string &message) const = 0

logs a log message to the system logger.

time value is taken from now

Parameters

  • [in] level: Level

  • [in] participant_name: The name of the participant

  • [in] logger_name: the name of the logger

  • [in] message: the message that will be forwarded

virtual std::string getUrl() const = 0

gets a valid url for registering the system instance to the participants logging service.

Return

returns a valid url for registering the system instance to the participants logging service.

class ParticipantProxy
#include <participant_proxy.h>

The ParticipantProxy will provide common system access to the participants system interfaces (RPC Services).

use fep3::System to connect

With the getRPCComponentProxy following interfaces are supported:

  • fep3::rpc::IRPCParticipantInfo

  • fep3::rpc::IRPCDataRegistry

  • fep3::rpc::IRPCParticipantStateMachine

Public Functions

ParticipantProxy()

Construct a new Participant Proxy object.

~ParticipantProxy()

DTOR.

ParticipantProxy(const std::string &participant_name, const std::string &participant_url, const std::string &system_name, const std::string &system_url, std::shared_ptr<ISystemLogger> logger, std::chrono::milliseconds default_timeout)

Construct a new Participant Proxy object.

Parameters

  • [in] participant_name: name of the participant

  • [in] participant_url: participants server url of the participant

  • [in] system_name: name of the system

  • [in] system_url: url of the system

  • [in] logger: logger to log values to.

  • [in] default_timeout: default timeout for each rpc request

void setInitPriority(int32_t priority)

set priority that the participant should use when the system is triggered into state FS_READY.

/note the initializing priority has nothing in common with the start priority and will be evaluated separately The lower the priority the later the participant will be triggered. Negative values are allowed

See

fep3::System::load, fep3::System::initialize

Parameters

  • [in] priority: priority, the participant should use for loading, initialization

int32_t getInitPriority() const

Get the Init Priority.

Return

int32_t the value of priority

See

fep3::System::load, fep3::System::initialize

void setStartPriority(int32_t priority)

set priority that the participant should use when the system is triggered into state running.

/note the starting priority has nothing in common with the init priority and will be evaluated separately. The lower the priority the later the participant will be triggered. Negative values are allowed

See

fep3::System::start, fep3::System::pause

Parameters

  • [in] priority: priority, the participant should use for initialization

int32_t getStartPriority() const

Get the Start Priority.

Return

int32_t the value of priority

See

fep3::System::start, fep3::System::pause

  • [in] value: the value

gets additional information corresponding with the participant

std::string the value found or the value_default

Parameters

  • [in] value_default: the value if the key is not found

bool getRPCComponentProxy(const std::string &component_name, const std::string &component_iid, IRPCComponentPtr &proxy_ptr) const

this internal function searches and connect to the participants RPC Service by name and id.

Please use i.e. getRPCComponentProxy<rpc::IParticipantStateMachine>(…)

Return

true if the server is reachable, false otherwise (not reachable, the server object does not exist, or the given interface is not supported)

Parameters

  • [in] component_name: the rpc server name of the rpc component

  • [in] component_iid: the rpc server interface identifier of the rpc component to request

  • [out] proxy_ptr: will contain the valid interface if available

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: See exception for more information

bool getRPCComponentProxyByIID(const std::string &component_iid, IRPCComponentPtr &proxy_ptr) const

this internal function searches and connect to the participants RPC Server by id.

It uses the first found. Please use i.e. getRPCComponentProxyByIID<rpc::IParticipantStateMachine>(…)

Return

true the server is reachable, false otherwise (the server is not reachable, the server object does not exist, or the given interface is not supported)

Parameters

  • [in] component_iid: the rpc component service interface identifier looking for

  • [out] proxy_ptr: will contain the valid interface if available

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: See exception for more information

template<typename T>
RPCComponent<T> getRPCComponentProxy() const

This will retrieve a rpc server object interface.

The fep3::ParticipantProxy does support following interfaces at the moment:

  • see fep3::ParticipantProxy

Return

rpc_component<T> the fep_rpc_client interface

Template Parameters

  • T: RPC Interfaces which are valid (see fep3::rpc)

Return Value

  • empty: RPCComponent<T> if not found.

template<typename T>
RPCComponent<T> getRPCComponentProxyByIID() const

This will retrieve a rpc server object interface by iid.

it returns the first found. The fep3::ParticipantProxy does support following interfaces at the moment:

  • see fep3::ParticipantProxy

Return

rpc_component<T> the fep_rpc_client interface

Template Parameters

  • T: RPC Interfaces which are valid (see fep3::rpc)

Return Value

  • empty: RPCComponent<T> if not found.

void deregisterLogging()

If logging is enabled, this unregisters from logger.

bool loggingRegistered() const

Check if the participant has a system logger interface registered.

Return Value

  • True: if a logging interface is registered, false otherwise.

class System
#include <fep_system.h>

FEP System class is a collection of fep3::ParticipantProxy.

You may create a fep::System by using the CTOR fep3::System() 

//this functionality may be used if you know your system
//construct a system that will be connected to the default discover address
fep::System my_system("my_system");
my_system.add("my_participant_1");
//now your system contains one participant
my_system.add("my_participant_2");
//now your system contains two participants

See

fep3::discoverSystem

Subclassed by System

Public Types

using State = SystemState

System state.

using AggregatedState = SystemAggregatedState

Definition of the Aggregated system state.

Public Functions

System()

Construct a new System object.

Remark

at the moment of FEP 2 there is no system affiliation implemented within the participants. for fep3 the system name will be considered. If empty the system name is really not set!

System(const std::string &system_name)

Construct a new System object.

Remark

at the moment of FEP 2 there is no system affiliation implemented within the participants.

Parameters

  • [in] system_name: the name of the system to construct

Remark

at the moment of FEP 2 there is no system affiliation implemented within the participants.

  • [in] system_name: the name of the system to construct

  • [in] system_discovery_url: the url for discovery of the system

Remark

we cannot copy the registered event monitor! This is also a very expensive operation; use move instead if possible!

  • [in] other: the other system object to copy from

  • [in] other: the other system object to move from

void setSystemState(System::AggregatedState state, std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_TRANSITION_TIMEOUT) const

Sets the system state depending on the current state this function will increase or decrease the system state to the given AggregatedState.

Only homogenous system states are valid as starting point.

Parameters

  • [in] state: the aggregated state to set

  • [in] timeout: the timeout used for each state change

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: if a homogenous state cannot be reached or the starting state is not homogenous

void load(std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_TRANSITION_TIMEOUT) const

sends a load event to every participant

Parameters

  • [in] timeout: timeout for waiting on the response of every participant

Exceptions

  • throws: a logical_error if a participant declined the state change (i.e. it is in the wrong state)

void unload(std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_TRANSITION_TIMEOUT) const

sends an unload event to every participant

Parameters

  • [in] timeout: timeout for waiting on the response of every participant

Exceptions

  • throws: a logical_error if a participant declined the state change (i.e. it is in the wrong state)

Parameters

  • [in] participants: map of participant names and url pairs

adds the list of participants to the system in an asynchronous execution Function returnes once the participants are added to the system.

Parameters

  • [in] participants: map of participant names and url pairs

  • [in] pool_size: size of the thread pool to be used for the parallel execution.

void clear()

clearSystem removes all current participants from the system

Remark

existing references to participant proxy instances are disconnected from this system object

void configureTiming(const std::string &master_clock_name, const std::string &slave_clock_name, const std::string &scheduler, const std::string &master_element_id, const std::string &master_time_stepsize, const std::string &master_time_factor, const std::string &slave_sync_cycle_time) const

Configures the timing.

The general function is for custom timing types only.

Note

master_clock_name, master_time_stepsize, master_time_factor and slave_sync_cycle_time will only be set if the master_element_id is a non-empty string.

Parameters

  • [in] master_clock_name: The name of the clock of the timing master.

  • [in] slave_clock_name: The name of the sync clock of the timing clients.

  • [in] scheduler: The name of the scheduler.

  • [in] master_element_id: The element id (participant name) of the timing master.

  • [in] master_time_stepsize: The time in ns between discrete time steps. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

  • [in] master_time_factor: Multiplication factor of the simulation speed. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

  • [in] slave_sync_cycle_time: The time in ns between synchronizations. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: if one of the timing properties cannot be set

void configureTiming3NoMaster() const

Configures the timing by resetting timing master.

Each particiapnt will work in system time by itself

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: if one of the timing properties cannot be set

void configureTiming3ClockSyncOnlyInterpolation(const std::string &master_element_id, const std::string &slave_sync_cycle_time) const

Configures the timing by setting the participant with the master element name as master.

Note

slave_sync_cycle_time will only be set if the master_element_id is a non-empty string.

Parameters

  • [in] master_element_id: The element id (participant name) of the timing master.

  • [in] slave_sync_cycle_time: The time in ns between synchronizations. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: if one of the timing properties cannot be set

void configureTiming3ClockSyncOnlyDiscrete(const std::string &master_element_id, const std::string &slave_sync_cycle_time) const

Configures the timing by setting the participant with the master element name as master.

Note

slave_sync_cycle_time will only be set if the master_element_id is a non-empty string.

Parameters

  • [in] master_element_id: The element id (participant name) of the timing master.

  • [in] slave_sync_cycle_time: The time in ns between synchronizations. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: if one of the timing properties cannot be set

void configureTiming3DiscreteSteps(const std::string &master_element_id, const std::string &master_time_stepsize, const std::string &master_time_factor) const

Configures the timing by setting the participant with the master element name as master, the master clock is a discrete clock.

Note

master_time_stepsize and master_time_factor will only be set if the master_element_id is a non-empty string.

Parameters

  • [in] master_element_id: The element id (participant name) of the timing master.

  • [in] master_time_stepsize: The time in ns between discrete time steps. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

  • [in] master_time_factor: Multiplication factor of the simulation speed. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: if one of the timing properties cannot be set

void configureTiming3AFAP(const std::string &master_element_id, const std::string &master_time_stepsize) const

Configures the timing by setting the participant with the master element name as master, the master clock is a discrete clock.

This is the same call than configureTiming3DiscreteSteps with time factor 0.0

Note

master_time_stepsize will only be set if the master_element_id is a non-empty string.

Parameters

  • [in] master_element_id: The element id (participant name) of the timing master.

  • [in] master_time_stepsize: The time in ns between discrete time steps. Won’t be set if an empty string gets passed.

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: if one of the timing properties cannot be set

std::vector<std::string> getCurrentTimingMasters() const

retrieves the current set timing masters set on each participant.

Return

the list of the timing masters within the system.

std::map<std::string, std::unique_ptr<IProperties>> getTimingProperties() const

retrieves the timing related properties on each participant.

Return

participant name-property list map of timing related properties.

State getSystemState(std::chrono::milliseconds timeout = FEP_SYSTEM_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) const

getSystemState determines the aggregated state of all participants in a system.

To find the aggregated state of the system, the states of all participants are sorted according to their weight (see below). The lowest state in the list is chosen. The relative weights are: Shutdown < Error < Startup < Idle < Initializing < Ready < Running.

Note

Even if the timeout parameter is lower than 500 ms, the call will still take at least 500 ms if no participant list is specified

Note

This method is not thread safe. Do not call concurrently inside the same participant!

Return

State

Remark

On Failure a IEventMonitor::onLog will be send with a detailed description

Parameters

  • [in] timeout: (ms) time how long this method waits maximally for other participants to respond

std::string getSystemName() const

Get the System Name object.

Return

std::string the name given at construction time

std::string getSystemUrl() const

Get the System Discovery Url object.

Return

std::string the name given at construction time

void registerMonitoring(IEventMonitor &event_listener)

Register monitoring listener for state and name changed notifications of the whole system.

Parameters

  • [in] event_listener: The listener

Return Value

  • true/false: Everything went fine/Something went wrong. On Failure an Incident will be send with a detailed description

void unregisterMonitoring(IEventMonitor &event_listener)

Unregister monitoring listener for state and name changed and logging notifications.

Parameters

  • [in] event_listener: The listener

void setSeverityLevel(LoggerSeverity severity_level)

Set the System Severity Level for all participants.

Parameters

  • [in] severity_level: minimum severity level

struct SystemState
#include <fep_system.h>

System state The aggregated state is always the lowest state of the participants.

if the system state is homogeneous, then every participant in the system have the same participant state.

Each participant where the participant state is undefined is not considered except every participant is undefined.

Public Functions

SystemState()

CTOR.

~SystemState()

DTOR.

SystemState(SystemState&&)

Move DTOR.

SystemState(const SystemState&)

Copy DTOR.

SystemState &operator=(SystemState&&)

move assignment

Return

SystemState&

SystemState &operator=(const SystemState&)

copy assignment

Return

SystemState&

SystemState(bool homogeneous, const SystemAggregatedState &state)

CTOR to set values immediately.

Parameters

  • [in] homogeneous: if the system state is homogeneous, then every participant in the system have the same participant state

  • [in] state: the aggregated state is always the lowest state of the participants

SystemState(const SystemAggregatedState &state)

CTOR to set a homogenous state.

Parameters

  • [in] state: the aggregated state is always the lowest state of the participants

Public Members

bool _homogeneous

homogenous value

SystemAggregatedState _state

the aggregated state is always the lowest state of the participants

namespace arya

Version namespace.

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for functionality introduced in version 3.0.

FEP 3 SDK version namespace for all interfaces and public implementations introduced in version 3.0.

FEP 3 SDK Participant namespace for all interfaces and public implementations introduced in version 3.0.

Template Parameters

  • T: The object pointer type to manage

Alias for duration in nanoseconds.

using IRPCComponentPtr = fep3::rpc::arya::IRPCClientPtr

alias definition for a clear API.

The IRPCComponentPtr represents the RPC Service Interface of one component.

template<typename T>
using RPCComponent = fep3::rpc::arya::RPCClient<T>

alias definition for a clear API.

Helper smart pointer for reference counting of the component interfaces

Template Parameters

  • T: The IRPCPbject

Enums

enum LoggerSeverity

Filter for logging events, the smaller the number the less events will be given.

Values:

off = 0

Intended to turn off logging.

fatal = 1

Very severe error event that will presumably lead the application to abort.

error = 2

Error event that might still allow the application to continue running.

warning = 3

Designates potentially harmful situations.

info = 4

Informational message that highlights the progress of the application.

debug = 5

Fine-grained informational event that is most useful to debug an application.

off = 0

Intended to turn off logging.

fatal = 1

Very severe error event that will presumably lead the application to abort.

error = 2

Error event that might still allow the application to continue running.

warning = 3

Designates potentially harmful situations.

info = 4

Informational message that highlights the progress of the application.

debug = 5

Fine-grained informational event that is most useful to debug an application.

enum LoggerSeverity

Filter for logging events, the smaller the number the less events will be given.

Values:

off = 0

Intended to turn off logging.

fatal = 1

Very severe error event that will presumably lead the application to abort.

error = 2

Error event that might still allow the application to continue running.

warning = 3

Designates potentially harmful situations.

info = 4

Informational message that highlights the progress of the application.

debug = 5

Fine-grained informational event that is most useful to debug an application.

off = 0

Intended to turn off logging.

fatal = 1

Very severe error event that will presumably lead the application to abort.

error = 2

Error event that might still allow the application to continue running.

warning = 3

Designates potentially harmful situations.

info = 4

Informational message that highlights the progress of the application.

debug = 5

Fine-grained informational event that is most useful to debug an application.

Functions

std::string getString(arya::LoggerSeverity severity)

Gets the severity represented as string.

Return

The severity represented as string

Parameters

  • [in] severity: The severity

template<class T>
std::string getComponentIID()

Get the Component Interface ID for the given interface type T The interface type T must define the interface by the helper macro (FEP_COMPONENT_IID)

Return

std::string

Template Parameters

  • T: The interface type

template<class interface_type>
interface_type *getComponent(const arya::IComponents &components)

helper function to retrieve a component from the module’s components registry

Return

INTERFACE*

Template Parameters

  • INTERFACE: the interface of the component

Parameters

  • [in] components: the components container

Return Value

  • nullptr: the interface was not found

std::unique_ptr<IDataRegistry::IDataReader> addDataIn(arya::IDataRegistry &data_registry, const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &stream_type, size_t queue_capacity = 1)

Helper function to register data to a given registry and create a reader immediately.

Return

std::unique_ptr<IDataRegistry::IDataReader> The return pointer is always valid but the reader methods will return ERR_NOT_INITIALISED if the module is not at least in state FS_READY or the incoming data has been unregistered.

Parameters

  • [in] data_registry: The data registry to register the incoming data to

  • [in] name: The name of the incoming data (must be unique and contain alphanumeric characters or underscore only)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of this data (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The maximum number of items that the reader queue can hold at a time

std::unique_ptr<arya::IDataRegistry::IDataWriter> addDataOut(arya::IDataRegistry &data_registry, const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &stream_type, size_t queue_capacity = 0)

Helper function to register data to a given registry and create a writer immediately.

Return

std::unique_ptr<IDataRegistry::IDataWriter> The return pointer is always valid but the writer methods will return ERR_NOT_INITIALISED if the module is not at least in state FS_READY or the outgoing data has been unregistered.

Parameters

  • [in] data_registry: The data registry to register the outgoing data to

  • [in] name: The name of the outgoing data (must be unique and contain alphanumeric characters or underscore only)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of this data (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The maximum number of items that the transmit queue can hold at a time.

template<class lhs_type, class rhs_type>
constexpr bool operator==(const fep3::arya::Optional<lhs_type> &lhs, const fep3::arya::Optional<rhs_type> &rhs)

Comparison for equality of fep3::arya::Optional.

Return

true if left- and right-hand side optional are equal, false otherwise

Template Parameters

  • lhs_type: The type of the left-hand side optional

  • rhs_type: The type of the right-hand side optional

Parameters

  • [in] lhs: The left-hand side optional

  • [in] rhs: The right-hand side optional

template<class lhs_type, class rhs_type>
constexpr bool operator!=(const fep3::arya::Optional<lhs_type> &lhs, const fep3::arya::Optional<rhs_type> &rhs)

Comparison for inequality of fep3::arya::Optional.

Return

true if left- and right-hand side optional are not equal, false otherwise

Template Parameters

  • lhs_type: The type of the left-hand side optional

  • rhs_type: The type of the right-hand side optional

Parameters

  • [in] lhs: The left-hand side optional

  • [in] rhs: The right-hand side optional

Participant createParticipant(const std::string &name, const std::string &version_info, const std::string &system_name, const std::shared_ptr<const arya::IElementFactory> &factory, const std::string &server_address_url = std::string())

Creates a participant.

friend class declaration

Return

Participant The created participant

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the participant to be created

  • [in] system_name: Name of the system this participant belongs to

  • [in] version_info: Version information of the participant to be created

  • [in] factory: factory instance which is able to create the element during load command

  • [in] server_address_url: forced server URL for the participant where it is reachable

template<typename element_factory>
Participant createParticipant(const std::string &name, const std::string &version_info, const std::string &system_name, const std::string &server_address_url = std::string())

Creates a participant.

Return

Participant The created participant

Template Parameters

  • element_factory: type of the factory which is able to create the element

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the participant to be created

  • [in] system_name: Name of the system this participant belongs to

  • [in] version_info: Version information of the participant to be created

  • [in] server_address_url: forced server URL for the participant where it is reachable

class BadOptionalAccess : public exception
#include <fep3_optional.h>

Exception class used by Optional.

class CommandLineParser
#include <commandline_parser.h>

Class for a command line parser that can be passed to a createParticipant function.

The following natively supported command line arguments are already defined: -?, -h, help display usage information -v, version Print FEP SDK version. -n, name <string> Set participant name. -s, system <string> Set the system of the participant. -u, url <string> Set the server address url

Public Functions

virtual void parseArgs(int argc, char const *const *argv) = 0

Method to parse command line arguments exits after printing message for erroneous parameters, help or version request.

Parameters

  • [in] argc: number of command line arguments (including executable name)

  • [in] argv: command line arguments in C strings (including executable name)

virtual std::string getParticipantName() = 0

Method to fetch participant name from arguments.

Return

participant name

virtual std::string getSystemName() = 0

Method to fetch system name from arguments.

Return

system name

virtual std::string getServerAddressUrl() = 0

Method to fetch server address URL name from arguments.

Return

server address URL

virtual ~CommandLineParser() = 0

DTOR.

class CommandLineParserFactory
#include <commandline_parser.h>

Factory class for the command line parser.

Public Static Functions

static std::unique_ptr<CommandLineParser> create(clara::Parser cli, ParserDefaultValues default_values = {})

Factory function to create a command line parser.

Return

A smart pointer to a fully initialized parser that can be passed to a createParticipant function

Parameters

  • [in] cli: Used to add user defined command line arguments to the command line parser

  • [in] default_values: Default values for the natively supported command line arguments

class IClock
#include <clock_intf.h>

Interface of a clock.

Subclassed by ClockBase, Clock

Public Types

enum ClockType

Type of a clock.

Values:

continuous = 0

A continuous clock will steadily raise the time value.

discrete = 1

A discrete clock will jump configured or calculated time steps.

Remark

It depends on the implementation which logical time steps are used.

Public Functions

virtual std::string getName() const = 0

Get the Name of the clock.

Return

Name of the clock

virtual ClockType getType() const = 0

Get the Type of the clock.

Return

The type of the clock

Return Value

  • ClockType::continuous: The clock implementation is a continuous clock

  • ClockType::discrete: The clock implementation is a discrete clock

virtual arya::Timestamp getTime() const = 0

Get the current time of the clock.

Return

Current time of the clock

virtual void reset(fep3::arya::Timestamp new_time) = 0

Reset the clock.

Depending on the implementation the offset will be reset.

Remark

The IEventSink::timeResetBegin and the IEventSink::timeResetEnd will be emitted

Parameters

  • [in] new_time: The new time of the clock

virtual void start(const std::weak_ptr<IEventSink> &event_sink) = 0

Start the clock.

Remark

The reset events IEventSink::timeResetBegin and IEventSink::timeResetEnd will be emitted to event_sink.

Remark

If event_sink is a IClock::ClockType::discrete also the events IEventSink::timeUpdateBegin, IEventSink::timeUpdating, IEventSink::timeUpdateEnd will be emitted to event_sink.

Parameters

  • [in] event_sink: The event sink to emit time reset and time updating events to.

virtual void stop() = 0

Stop the clock.

Usually the clock will reset immediately (still depending on the implementation).

class IEventSink
#include <clock_intf.h>

Event sink to react synchronously on time reset and time update events.

Subclassed by Clock::EventSink

Public Functions

virtual void timeUpdateBegin(arya::Timestamp old_time, arya::Timestamp new_time) = 0

This event is emitted before the time is updated.

The IClock::getTime value is still old_time.

Remark

This event is only emitted by discrete clocks (ClockType::discrete)

Parameters

  • [in] old_time: The time before updating

  • [in] new_time: The future time after updating

virtual void timeUpdating(arya::Timestamp new_time) = 0

This event is emitted while the time is being updated.

Remark

This event is only emitted by discrete clocks (ClockType::discrete)

Parameters

  • [in] new_time: The future time after updating

virtual void timeUpdateEnd(arya::Timestamp new_time) = 0

This event is emitted after the time was updated.

The IClock::getTime value was set to the new_time.

Remark

This event is only emitted by discrete clocks (ClockType::discrete)

Parameters

  • [in] new_time: The current time after the update

virtual void timeResetBegin(arya::Timestamp old_time, arya::Timestamp new_time) = 0

This event is emitted before the time will be reset.

It is used to inform about time jumps to the future or the past! The IClock::getTime value is still old_time.

Parameters

  • [in] old_time: The time before resetting

  • [in] new_time: The future time after resetting

virtual void timeResetEnd(arya::Timestamp new_time) = 0

This event is emitted after the time was reset.

The IClock::getTime value was already set to new_time.

Parameters

  • [in] new_time: The current time after the reset

class IClockRegistry
#include <clock_registry_intf.h>

Interface of the clock registry The clock registry may be used to register clocks.

Subclassed by IClockService

Public Types

using Clocks = std::map<std::string, std::shared_ptr<arya::IClock>>

Map of clock entries.

Public Functions

virtual fep3::Result registerClock(const std::shared_ptr<arya::IClock> &clock) = 0

Register a clock.

The name of the clock must be unique within this registry.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] clock: The clock to register

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_ARG: A clock with the same name as clock is already registered.

  • ERR_INVALID_STATE: Clock service is in state running in which registration of clocks is not allowed.

virtual fep3::Result unregisterClock(const std::string &clock_name) = 0

Unregister a clock by name.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] clock_name: The name of the clock

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_ARG: The clock with name clock_name is a default clock or no clock with name clock_name is registered.

  • ERR_INVALID_STATE: Clock service is in state running in which deregistration of clocks is not allowed.

virtual std::list<std::string> getClockNames() const = 0

Get a list of all clock names.

Return

The list of clocks that are registered

virtual std::shared_ptr<arya::IClock> findClock(const std::string &clock_name) const = 0

Get a clock by name.

Return

The clock with name clock_name

Parameters

  • [in] clock_name: The name of the clock

Parameters

virtual std::string getMainClockName() const = 0

Get the name of the current main clock.

Return

Before the component is tensed the value of main clock property node, otherwise the name of the current main clock

Gets the component ready for running state.

virtual fep3::Result relax() = 0

Makes the component falling back to a simple initialized state Relax is the antonym of tense.

class IComponents
#include <components_intf.h>

the components composition will manage and hold the instances of all components.

The registered components can be obtained by its interface identifier (see FEP3_COMPONENT_IID)

Subclassed by Components

Public Functions

template<class interface_type>
interface_type *getComponent() const

Get the component pointer of the registered component that is registered with the component interface id of interface_type (see FEP3_COMPONENT_IID)

Template Parameters

  • interface_type: the component interface to retrieve.

Return Value

  • valid: pointer to an instance of the given type interface_type

  • nullptr: if not found

class IConfigurationService
#include <configuration_service_intf.h>

The configuration service is a tree-based container for configuration information.

Its purpose is to act as a central instance for providing configuration information of a participant. Components can use the service to access configuration information of other components and provide their one. The service manages property nodes implementing fep3::arya::IPropertyNode. An fep3::arya::IPropertyNode stores a value as well as a list of childs of type fep3::arya::IPropertyNode. Typically the content of the fep3::arya::IConfigurationService is also available via rpc.

Public Functions

FEP_COMPONENT_IID("configuration_service.arya.fep3.iid")

the fep component interface identifier for the IConfigurationService

virtual fep3::Result registerNode(std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IPropertyNode> property_node) = 0

Register the node property_node as main node.

The node name of property_node has to be unique within all registered main nodes.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] property_node: Node to register at the configuration service.

Return Value

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: if a node with the same name is already registered.

virtual fep3::Result unregisterNode(const std::string &name) = 0

Unregister a main node with name.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the node to unregister

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: if a node with name is not registered.

virtual bool isNodeRegistered(const std::string &path) const = 0

Checks whether the node with path is registered with the service.

Return

true if the node is registered with the service, false otherwise.

Parameters

  • [in] path: Path of the node to search for.

virtual std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IPropertyNode> getNode(const std::string &path) const = 0

Searches for a node with path.

The root node can only be returned using getConstNode The node can be used to either read or change a property.

Return

shared_ptr to the node

Parameters

  • [in] path: Path of the node to search for and return (e.g. Clock, Clock/MainClock etc.)

Return Value

  • Default: constructed shared_ptr if node path is not valid

  • Default: constructed shared_ptr if node was not found.

virtual std::shared_ptr<const fep3::arya::IPropertyNode> getConstNode(const std::string &path = "") const = 0

Searches for a node with path.

Return

shared_ptr to the node

Parameters

  • [in] path: Path of the node to search for and return (e.g. Clock, Clock/MainClock etc.). If path is provided as an empty string, the root node will be returned.

Return Value

  • Default: constructed shared_ptr if node path is not valid.

  • Default: constructed shared_ptr if node was not found.

class IDataRegistry
#include <data_registry_intf.h>

Interface for the data registry.

Public Types

using IDataReceiver = arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReceiver

DataReceiver class provides an callback entry for the fep3::arya::IDataRegistry::registerDataReceiveListener function to receive data as a synchronous call (data triggered)

Public Functions

FEP_COMPONENT_IID("data_registry.arya.fep3.iid")

Definition of the component interface identifier for the data registry.

virtual fep3::Result registerDataIn(const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &type, bool is_dynamic_meta_type = false) = 0

Registers an incoming date with the given name to the simulation bus when the participant is done initializing.

This implementation will NOT immediately register it to the simulation bus synchronously within this call.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

See

unregisterDataIn, getReader, registerDataReceiveListener

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the incoming data (must be unique and contain alphanumeric characters or underscore only)

  • [in] type: The stream type of this data (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] is_dynamic_meta_type: The stream_meta_type may change of this data while streaming, this means the given type is the first expected one.

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: The name already exists with a different type

  • ERR_NOT_SUPPORTED: Stream type is not supported

virtual fep3::Result registerDataOut(const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &type, bool is_dynamic_meta_type = false) = 0

Registers an outgoing date with the given name to the simulation bus when the participant is done initializing.

This implementation will NOT immediately register it to the simulation bus synchronously within this call.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

See

unregisterDataOut, getWriter

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the outgoing data (must be unique and contain alphanumeric characters or underscore only)

  • [in] type: The stream type of this data (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] is_dynamic_meta_type: The change of the meta type is allowed while sending.

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: The name already exists with a different type

  • ERR_NOT_SUPPORTED: Stream type is not supported

virtual fep3::Result unregisterDataIn(const std::string &name) = 0

Unregisters incoming data.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

See

registerDataIn

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the incoming data (must be unique)

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: No incoming data with this name found

virtual fep3::Result unregisterDataOut(const std::string &name) = 0

Unregisters outgoing data.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

See

registerDataOut

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the outgoing data (must be unique)

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: No outgoing data with this name found

virtual fep3::Result registerDataReceiveListener(const std::string &name, const std::shared_ptr<IDataReceiver> &listener) = 0

Registers a listener for data receive events and changes.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if registration succeeded, error code otherwise:

See

registerDataIn

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the incoming data to listen to

  • [in] listener: A shared pointer to the listener implementation

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: No incoming data with this name found

virtual fep3::Result unregisterDataReceiveListener(const std::string &name, const std::shared_ptr<IDataReceiver> &listener) = 0

Unregisters a data receive listener.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if unregistering succeeded, error code otherwise:

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the incoming data to listen to

  • [in] listener: A shared pointer to the listener implementation

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: No incoming data with this name found

virtual std::unique_ptr<IDataRegistry::IDataReader> getReader(const std::string &name) = 0

Get a reader for the incoming data with the given name.

Queue capacity is 1, so only the last item will be read.

Note

Since incoming data and their readers get registered at the simulation bus only after the initialization of the participant is done this method has to be called during initialization or before.

Return

std::unique_ptr<IDataReader> The return pointer is only a nullptr if the signal is not registered with DataRegistry::addDataIn beforehand and the reader methods will return ERR_NOT_INITIALISED if the module is not at least in state FS_READY or the incoming data has been unregistered.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the incoming data

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: Bad memory allocation

virtual std::unique_ptr<IDataRegistry::IDataReader> getReader(const std::string &name, size_t queue_capacity) = 0

Get a reader for the incoming data with the given name.

Note

Since incoming data and their readers get registered at the simulation bus only after the initialization of the participant is done this method has to be called during initialization or before.

Return

std::unique_ptr<IDataReader> The return pointer is only a nullptr if the signal is not registered with DataRegistry::addDataIn beforehand and the reader methods will return ERR_NOT_INITIALISED if the module is not at least in state FS_READY or the incoming data has been unregistered.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the incoming data

  • [in] queue_capacity: The maximum number of items that the reader queue can hold at a time

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: Bad memory allocation

virtual std::unique_ptr<IDataRegistry::IDataWriter> getWriter(const std::string &name) = 0

Get a writer for the outgoing data with the given name.

Queue capacity is 0, so data will be written immediately.

Note

Since outgoing data and their writers get registered at the simulation bus only after the initialization of the participant is done this method has to be called during initialization or before.

Return

std::unique_ptr<IDataWriter> The return pointer is always valid but the writer methods will return ERR_NOT_INITIALISED if the module is not at least in state FS_READY or the outgoing data has been unregistered.

See

IDataWriter, IDataWriter::write

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the outgoing data

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: Bad memory allocation

virtual std::unique_ptr<IDataRegistry::IDataWriter> getWriter(const std::string &name, size_t queue_capacity) = 0

Get a writer for the outgoing data with the given name.

If queue_capacity is not 0 the writer will request a specific amount of sample buffer from the simulation bus.

Note

Since outgoing data and their writers get registered at the simulation bus only after the initialization of the participant is done this method has to be called during initialization or before.

Return

std::unique_ptr<IDataWriter> The return pointer is always valid but the writer methods will return ERR_NOT_INITIALISED if the module is not at least in state FS_READY or the outgoing data has been unregistered.

See

IDataWriter, IDataWriter::write

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the outgoing data

  • [in] queue_capacity: The maximum number of items that the transmit queue can hold at a time.

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: Bad memory allocation

class IDataReader
#include <data_registry_intf.h>

Class providing access to input data.

See

fep3::IDataRegistry::getReader

Public Functions

virtual ~IDataReader()

DTOR.

virtual size_t size() const = 0

Gets the current size of the item queue.

Return

The current size of the item queue

virtual size_t capacity() const = 0

Gets the current capacity of the item queue.

Return

The current capacity of the item queue

virtual fep3::Result pop(IDataReceiver &receiver) = 0

Pops the front item from the reader queue (if not empty) and passes it to the callback of receiver.

This method is non-blocking.

Remark

If “data triggered” reception is currently running (see method fep3::IDataRegistry::registerDataReceiveListener) the reader queue is always empty because incoming data will immediately be passed to the “data triggered” receivers.

Return

ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

Parameters

  • [in] receiver: The receiver object to be called back if an item is in the reader queue

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_INITIALISED: Data registry has not been initialized

  • ERR_FAILED: No item has been passed to the receiver

virtual arya::Optional<arya::Timestamp> getFrontTime() const = 0

Gets the time of the front item in the reader queue.

Return

The timestamp of the front item, if at least one item is in the reader queue, invalid timestamp otherwise

class IDataWriter
#include <data_registry_intf.h>

Class providing access to output data.

See

fep3::IDataRegistry::getWriter

Public Functions

virtual ~IDataWriter()

DTOR.

virtual fep3::Result write(const arya::IDataSample &data_sample) = 0

forwards the content of the data_sample to the simulation bus

Return

ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

Parameters

  • [in] data_sample: The data sample to copy the content from

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_INITIALISED: Data registry has not been initialized

  • ERR_UNEXPECTED: An unexpected error occurred.

  • ERR_MEMORY: The transmit buffer’s memory is not suitable to hold the data_sample's content.

  • ERR_NOT_IMPL: There is no functioning implementation of this method.

  • ERR_NOT_CONNECTED: The data writer is not connected to the simulation bus.

virtual fep3::Result write(const arya::IStreamType &stream_type) = 0

forwards the content of the stream_type to the simulation bus

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise (

See

fep3::IDataRegistry::IDataWriter::write(const IDataSample&))

Parameters

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type to copy the content from

virtual fep3::Result flush() = 0

This method blocks until all content of the writer is forwarded.

Must be called after the last sample has been written by a job in a simulation cycle.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_INITIALISED: Data registry has not been initialized

  • ERR_UNEXPECTED: An unexpected error occurred.

  • ERR_NOT_CONNECTED: The data writer is not connected to a simulation bus resource.

  • ERR_FAILED: The flushing failed.

class IDataSample
#include <data_sample_intf.h>

Interface for one data sample.

A data sample is a abstraction for raw memory with a corresponding timestamp of creation (fep3::arya::IDataSample::getTime) and a counter (fep3::arya::IDataSample::getCounter)

Subclassed by DataSampleBase, DataSampleRawMemoryRef, DataSample

Public Functions

virtual arya::Timestamp getTime() const = 0

Get the time stamp of the object.

Usually the time of creation of the data as a reference to the main simulation time (fep3::arya::IClockService::getTime).

Return

The timestamp of the data sample in simulation time

virtual size_t getSize() const = 0

Get the Size of the data in bytes.

Return

size_t The size of the data in bytes

virtual uint32_t getCounter() const = 0

Get the counter of the sample set by the sender.

Return

uint32_t the counter

virtual size_t read(arya::IRawMemory &writeable_memory) const = 0

Calls the IRawMemory::set function to copy the memory content of the sample to the given writeable_memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in byte which are copied (usually it’s the return value of fep3::IRawMemory::set)

Parameters

  • [out] writeable_memory: The memory to copy the memory to (the callback to copy is the fep3::IRawMemory::set call)

virtual void setTime(const arya::Timestamp &time) = 0

Set the timestamp of the sample.

If set to 0 or lower the time will be set to the current simulation time (fep3::arya::IClockService::getTime) during transmission (see fep3::arya::IDataRegistry::IDataWriter::write).

Parameters

  • [in] time: The simulation time

virtual void setCounter(uint32_t counter) = 0

Set the counter.

Parameters

  • [in] counter: The counter set by the writer

virtual size_t write(const arya::IRawMemory &readable_memory) = 0

Changes and copies the given memory to the sample’s internal memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in bytes that were copied

Parameters

  • [in] readable_memory: The memory to copy (uses fep3::IRawMemory::cdata and fep3::IRawMemory::size to obtain)

class IElement
#include <element_intf.h>

This is the interface of one element the participant can deal with class for every FEP3 Element.

To implement your own FEP3 Element, derive from this class.

Subclassed by ElementBase

Public Functions

virtual ~IElement()

DTOR.

virtual std::string getTypename() = 0

Returns the type name of the element.

The type name represents the type the element is implementing.

Remark

This is not the instance name of the element! The instance name is usually the same as the name of the participant this element is loaded in.

Return

std::string Result of getTypename

virtual std::string getVersion() = 0

Returns the version of the element.

The version of the element implementation.

Remark

This is the instance version of the element type and will be used only for information at the moment! There is no further functionality or checks on that!

Return

std::string The version as string (this is vendor dependent, and only for information!)

virtual Result loadElement(const arya::IComponents &components) = 0

Loads internals of the element.

Return

Result error code

Parameters

  • [in] components: Reference to the components. This pointer is valid until unloadElement was called.

Return Value

  • NO_ERROR: if succeeded

virtual void unloadElement() = 0

Unloads internals of the element.

Return

Result error code

Return Value

  • NO_ERROR: if succeeded

virtual Result initialize() = 0

Initializes the element.

Return

Result error code

Return Value

  • NO_ERROR: if succeeded

virtual void deinitialize() = 0

Deinitializes the element.

virtual Result run() = 0

Runs the element.

Return

Result error code

Return Value

  • NO_ERROR: if succeeded

virtual void stop() = 0

Stops the element.

class IElementFactory
#include <element_factory_intf.h>

Interface for the element factory.

Subclassed by ElementFactory< element_type >

Public Functions

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::IElement> createElement(const arya::IComponents &components) const = 0

Creates the element.

Return

Shared pointer to the created element.

Parameters

  • [in] components: components reference to provide the component access
