class IJobRegistry
#include <job_registry_intf.h>

Interface of the job registry.

The job registry may be used to register jobs. Registered jobs may be triggered by the active scheduler.

Public Functions

FEP_COMPONENT_IID("job_registry.arya.fep3.iid")

The component interface identifier of IJobRegistry.

virtual fep3::Result addJob(const std::string &name, const std::shared_ptr<arya::IJob> &job, const arya::JobConfiguration &job_config) = 0

Register the given job at the job registry.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the job to be registered

  • [in] job: The job to be registered

  • [in] job_config: The job configuration of the job to be registered

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

virtual fep3::Result removeJob(const std::string &name) = 0

Unregister the job with the given name from the job registry.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the job to be removed

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: A job with the given name is not registered

virtual std::list<arya::JobInfo> getJobInfos() const = 0

Return the job info of all registered jobs.

Return

List containing job info of all registered jobs

virtual arya::Jobs getJobs() const = 0

Get all registered jobs.

Return

All registered Jobs

class ILogger
#include <logger_intf.h>

Logger interface to log messages to.

Public Functions

virtual fep3::Result logInfo(const std::string &message) const = 0

Log informational messages that highlight the progress of the application.

Return

Standard Result value

Parameters

  • [in] message: Info message

Return Value

  • ERR_MEMORY: The internal logging queue is full (console and listener)

  • ERR_POINTER: No log file has been configured or opened (only file)

  • ERR_DEVICE_IO: Writing log to file failed (only file)

  • ERR_EXCEPTION_RAISED: The RPC failed and threw an exception (only listener)

virtual fep3::Result logWarning(const std::string &message) const = 0

Log potentially harmful situations.

Return

Standard Result value. See logInfo() for all possible values.

Parameters

  • [in] message: Warning message

virtual fep3::Result logError(const std::string &message) const = 0

Log error events that might still allow the application to continue running.

Return

Standard Result value. See logInfo() for all possible values.

Parameters

  • [in] message: Error message

virtual fep3::Result logFatal(const std::string &message) const = 0

Log very severe error events that will presumably lead the application to abort.

Return

Standard Result value. See logInfo() for all possible values.

Parameters

  • [in] message: Fatal message

virtual fep3::Result logDebug(const std::string &message) const = 0

Log informational events that are most useful for debugging.

Return

Standard Result value. See logInfo() for all possible values.

Parameters

  • [in] message: Debug message

virtual bool isInfoEnabled() const = 0

Check whether the logger is enabled for INFO priority.

Return

true if INFO is enabled, false otherwise

virtual bool isWarningEnabled() const = 0

Check whether the logger is enabled for WARNING priority.

Return

true if WARNING is enabled, false otherwise

virtual bool isErrorEnabled() const = 0

Check whether the logger is enabled for ERROR priority.

Return

true if ERROR is enabled, false otherwise

virtual bool isFatalEnabled() const = 0

Check whether the logger is enabled for FATAL priority.

Return

true if FATAL is enabled, false otherwise

virtual bool isDebugEnabled() const = 0

Check whether the logger is enabled for DEBUG priority.

Return

true if DEBUG is enabled, false otherwise

class ILoggingService
#include <logging_service_intf.h>

Logging service of one participant.

The logging service will provide a single logging access point a within a participant as component.

Public Functions

FEP_COMPONENT_IID("logging_service.arya.fep3.iid")

the fep component interface identifier for the ILoggingService

virtual std::shared_ptr<arya::ILogger> createLogger(const std::string &logger_name) = 0

Creates a logger object that can be used to emit logs.

Return

Shared pointer to the created logger object.

Parameters

  • [in] logger_name: Name of the logger domain. Used to know from where the log is coming from and for configuration.

virtual fep3::Result registerSink(const std::string &name, const std::shared_ptr<ILoggingSink> &sink) = 0

Registers a logging sink with the given name.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the sink (must be unique)

  • [in] sink: the shared pointer of the sink the sink pointer must live until the unregister was called or the logging service is destroyed

Return Value

  • ERR_IN_USE: a sink with the name already exists

  • ERR_NO_ERROR: success

virtual fep3::Result unregisterSink(const std::string &name) = 0

Unregisters a logging sink with the given name.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the sink (must be unique and exists)

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: the sink with the name does not exists

  • ERR_NO_ERROR: success

Logging function called by the logging service.

Return

A standard result code to tell the logging service if the logging was successful

Parameters

  • [in] log: The log message with description, severity level, timestamp, logger/domain name and participant name

class IProperties
#include <properties_intf.h>

Properties interfaces to access a list of key value pairs.

Subclassed by ILoggingService::ILoggingSink, IStreamType, IStreamType

Public Functions

virtual ~IProperties()

DTOR.

virtual bool setProperty(const std::string &name, const std::string &value, const std::string &type) = 0

sets the value and type of the given property.

If the property does not exist it will add one. If the type is different, than the existing one it will change it.

Return

true if the value could be set false otherwise (There might be an exception depending on the implementation of the interface)

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the property (this is not a path, a single name)

  • [in] value: the value as string

  • [in] type: the string description of the type There are more types possible than the default types: fep3::base::PropertyType

virtual std::string getProperty(const std::string &name) const = 0

gets the property value as string

Return

std::string the value as string you may determine the type by using getPropertyType.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the property

virtual std::string getPropertyType(const std::string &name) const = 0

gets the property value

Return

std::string the type of the property. default types are define by fep3::base::PropertyType

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the property

virtual bool isEqual(const IProperties &properties) const = 0

compares this key value list with the given properties instance the properties are equal if each property of this will have the same value within properties

Return

true if each property of this have the same value within properties, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] properties: the properties instance to compare to

virtual void copyTo(IProperties &properties) const = 0

assignment helper

Parameters

  • [in] properties: properties to copy values of this property object to

virtual std::vector<std::string> getPropertyNames() const = 0

returns a list of all property names of this node

Return

vector of property names

virtual ~IProperties()

DTOR.

virtual bool setProperty(const std::string &name, const std::string &value, const std::string &type) = 0

sets the value and type of the given property.

If the property does not exist it will add one. If the type is different, than the existing one it will change it.

Return

true if the value could be set false otherwise (There might be an exception depending on the implementation of the interface)

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the property (this is not a path, a single name)

  • [in] value: the value as string

  • [in] type: the string description of the type There are more types possible than the default types: fep3::base::PropertyType

virtual std::string getProperty(const std::string &name) const = 0

gets the property value as string

Return

std::string the value as string you may determine the type by using getPropertyType.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the property

virtual std::string getPropertyType(const std::string &name) const = 0

gets the property value

Return

std::string the type of the property. default types are define by fep3::base::PropertyType

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the property

virtual bool isEqual(const IProperties &properties) const = 0

compares this key value list with the given properties instance the properties are equal if each property of this will have the same value within properties

Return

true if each property of this have the same value within properties, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] properties: the properties instance to compare to

virtual void copyTo(IProperties &properties) const = 0

assignment helper

Parameters

  • [in] properties: properties to copy values of this property object to

returns a list of all property names of this node

class IPropertyNode
#include <propertynode_intf.h>

Interface for a property node to store configuration information.

The node can be registered at the fep3::arya::IConfigurationService. The node consists of a value, a name and a vector of children.

Subclassed by IPropertyWithExtendedAccess

Public Functions

virtual std::string getName() const = 0

Get the name of the node.

Return

Name of node

virtual std::string getValue() const = 0

Get the current value of the node as string.

Return

Current value of node as std::string

virtual std::string getTypeName() const = 0

Get the type name of the node.

See fep3::base::arya::PropertyType<T>::getTypeName for default types.

Return

Type name of node

virtual fep3::Result setValue(const std::string &value, const std::string &type_name = "") = 0

Set the value of the node to value.

If a type_name is provided it has to be either equal to the type name of this node, or the implementation has to provide an internal conversion. If no conversion is provided an error will be returned.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] value: The value to set for the node as std::string

  • [in] type_name: The type, the value represents. Default value is “”.

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: if type_name is different than the type name of this node and no conversion is provided.

virtual bool isEqual(const IPropertyNode &other) const = 0

Compare the node with other for equality.

Comparison will be done for the nodes as well as all the children. Value, type and name have to be equal.

Return

true if equal, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] other: Node to compare this node with

virtual void reset() = 0

Reset this node itself and all its children.

The reset will change the value to the value at creation.

virtual std::vector<std::shared_ptr<IPropertyNode>> getChildren() const = 0

Get all children of the node.

Return

Vector of children

virtual size_t getNumberOfChildren() const = 0

Get the number of children of this node.

Return

Number of children

virtual std::shared_ptr<IPropertyNode> getChild(const std::string &name) const = 0

Get the child with the name name.

Return

Shared pointer to child with name name

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child to look for

Return Value

  • Empty: std::shared_ptr<IPropertyNode> if child was not found

virtual bool isChild(const std::string &name) const = 0

Check whether name is a child of this node.

Return

true if name is a child of this node, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child

class IRawMemory
#include <raw_memory_intf.h>

Raw Memory interface to access any kind of data by a raw memory pointer and its size.

Subclassed by DataSample, RawMemoryClassType< T, Enable >, RawMemoryClassType< const std::string, const std::string >, RawMemoryClassType< std::string, void >, RawMemoryClassType< std::vector< T >, void >, RawMemoryClassType< T, typename std::enable_if< std::is_const< T >::value >::type >, RawMemoryRef, RawMemoryStandardType< T, Enable >, RawMemoryStandardType< const std::string, const std::string >, RawMemoryStandardType< std::string, void >, RawMemoryStandardType< T, typename std::enable_if< std::is_const< T >::value >::type >, RawMemory, RawMemoryClassType< std::vector< T > >, RawMemoryClassType< T >, RawMemoryStandardType< T >

Public Functions

virtual size_t capacity() const = 0

Gets the capacity of the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

virtual const void *cdata() const = 0

Gets the raw pointer to the memory.

Return

const void* The pointer

virtual size_t size() const = 0

Gets the size of the current stored value in the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

virtual size_t set(const void *data, size_t data_size) = 0

Resets the memory of the raw pointer.

Return

size_t The size in bytes that were copied (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data: The data to set

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to set

virtual size_t resize(size_t data_size) = 0

Resizes the memory.

Return

size_t The new size in bytes (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to resize

class IRPCRequester
#include <rpc_intf.h>

Instance of one requester to send a client request to a server.

Public Functions

virtual fep3::Result sendRequest(const std::string &service_name, const std::string &request_message, IRPCResponse &response_callback) const = 0

send a request to the server and will wait for an answer

Return

returns an error code

Remark

the request_message content must be serialized already (usually i.e. a json-string)

Parameters

  • [in] service_name: the name of the service to reach

  • [in] request_message: the request message (serialized!)

  • [in] response_callback: the response callback interface to set the response to

Return Value

  • ERR_TIMEOUT: Timeout reached with no answer

  • ERR_IO_ERROR: server address not reachable or connection closed

  • ERR_NOERROR: response_callback will contain a valid response message

class IRPCResponse
#include <rpc_intf.h>

Interface of an RPC response.

Public Functions

virtual fep3::Result set(const std::string &response) = 0

Sets the response message.

Parameters

  • [in] response: The response data.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went as expected.

class IRPCServer
#include <rpc_intf.h>

one server access point

Subclassed by ServiceRegistryBase

Public Functions

Get the url of the server.

Return

std::string the url

virtual std::string getName() const = 0

Get the name.

Return

std::string the name

virtual void setName(const std::string &name) = 0

Sets the name.

Parameters

  • [in] name: the name

virtual fep3::Result registerService(const std::string &service_name, const std::shared_ptr<IRPCService> &service) = 0

Registers an RPC server with a unique service_name

Note

The server instance must be available as long as the server is registered.

Parameters

  • [in] service_name: The name of the server. oRPCObjectServerInstance name is updated.

  • [inout] service: The server that is registered.

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_ARG: If the name already exists

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went as expected.

virtual fep3::Result unregisterService(const std::string &service_name) = 0

Unregisters a server by its service_name.

Note

Only after the server is unregistered it may be deleted.

Parameters

  • [in] service_name: The name of the server.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: If the server is not registered.

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went as expected.

Public Static Attributes

constexpr const char *const _use_default_url = "use_default_url"

Definition that is used within implementations of IRPCService to identify that the default url can be used.

class IRPCService
#include <rpc_intf.h>

Service (a part of a server with a dedicated functionality)

Subclassed by RPCService< server_stub, rpc_interface >

Public Functions

virtual std::string getRPCServiceIIDs() const = 0

get the service id

Return Value

  • service: ID.

virtual std::string getRPCInterfaceDefinition() const = 0

get the interface definition

Return Value

  • interface: definition

virtual fep3::Result handleRequest(const std::string &content_type, const std::string &request_message, arya::IRPCRequester::IRPCResponse &response_message) = 0

Handles a request send to this server.

Parameters

  • [in] content_type: The content type of the request.

  • [in] request_message: The request message.

  • [out] response_message: The response message.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went as expected.

  • ERR_INVALID_ARG: Invalid arguments for the message.

  • ERR_UNEXPECTED: Something else went wrong.

class IScheduler
#include <scheduler_intf.h>

Interface for a Scheduler.

Subclassed by Scheduler

Public Functions

virtual ~IScheduler()

DTOR.

virtual std::string getName() const = 0

Get the Name of the scheduler.

Return

Name of the scheduler

virtual fep3::Result initialize(arya::IClockService &clock, const arya::Jobs &jobs) = 0

Initialize scheduler.

Note

The native implementation of FEP3_SCHEDULER_CLOCK_BASED uses the clock service and configurations of every registered job to create a timer thread for every job which triggers the job at the configured cycle time.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] clock: The local clock service

  • [in] jobs: The configurations of all jobs registered at the job registry

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

virtual fep3::Result start() = 0

Start the scheduler.

Note

The native implementation of FEP3_SCHEDULER_CLOCK_BASED starts every job timer thread and the scheduler service thread.

Return

fep3::Result

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

virtual fep3::Result stop() = 0

Stop the scheduler.

Note

The native implementation of the FEP3_SCHEDULER_CLOCK_BASED stops the scheduler service thread and every job timer thread.

Return

fep3::Result

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

virtual fep3::Result deinitialize() = 0

Deinitialize the scheduler.

The native implementation of the FEP3_SCHEDULER_CLOCK_BASED stops the scheduler service thread, every job timer thread and clears all job timer threads.

Return

fep3::Result

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

class ISchedulerRegistry
#include <scheduler_registry_intf.h>

Interface for the scheduler registry.

Subclassed by ISchedulerService

Public Functions

virtual fep3::Result registerScheduler(std::unique_ptr<arya::IScheduler> scheduler) = 0

Register the given scheduler.

Registered schedulers may be set as active scheduler.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] scheduler: Scheduler to be registered

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_INVALID_STATE: The Participant is already running

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: Scheduler with the given name is already registered

virtual fep3::Result unregisterScheduler(const std::string &scheduler_name) = 0

Unregister the scheduler with the given scheduler_name.

Return

FEP Result

Parameters

  • [in] scheduler_name: The name of the scheduler

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_INVALID_STATE: The Participant is already running

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: A scheduler with name scheduler_name is not registered

  • ERR_INVALID_ARG: You tried to unregister the default scheduler, which is not possible

virtual std::list<std::string> getSchedulerNames() const = 0

Return the names of all registered schedulers.

Return

List of all registered scheduler names

class ISchedulerService : public ISchedulerRegistry
#include <scheduler_service_intf.h>

Public Functions

FEP_COMPONENT_IID("scheduler_service.arya.fep3.iid")

virtual std::string getActiveSchedulerName() const = 0

Returns the name of the active scheduler.

Return

class IServiceBus
#include <service_bus_intf.h>

Service Bus component interface definition.

Public Types

using IParticipantServer = arya::IRPCServer

Alias class that represent a Participant in the System.

using IParticipantRequester = arya::IRPCRequester

Alias class that represents the possibility to request service functionality of a far participant.

Public Functions

FEP_COMPONENT_IID("service_bus.arya.fep3.iid")

definition of the component interface identifier for the IServiceBus

See

IComponents

virtual fep3::Result createSystemAccess(const std::string &system_name, const std::string &system_discovery_url, bool is_default = false) = 0

create a system access point to create a server (to be part of the system) or to discover and request within this system.

The server itself is one access point to the service bus, where services can be registered and unregistered to.

Return

depending on the service bus solution it will return with an error. see details of that error

Parameters

  • [in] system_name: the name of the system this server is belonging to

    • leave empty if there is no system this participant belongs to

    • set the name of the system. this usually is to discover only servers with the same system name

  • [in] system_discovery_url: the network address url to communicate with if discovery is used

    • for http we could set up i.e. a multicast address and a port

    • for rti dds we could set up rti-dds://fep3_default_discovery:0 to appear on domain 0 and answer a discovery call (this is usually a functionality already supported by rti)

    • if no discovery is used leave it empty

  • [in] is_default: create this access point as default system access to have easy access via IServiceBus::getServer and IServiceBus::getRequester which is used within the RPC implementation templates

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: no error occurred

virtual fep3::Result releaseSystemAccess(const std::string &system_name) = 0

releases the system access with the given system_name

Parameters

  • [in] system_name: name of the system access

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: no error occurred

virtual std::shared_ptr<IParticipantServer> getServer() const = 0

get the participants server at the default system access

Return

the server if it does exist

Remark

this will only return a valid value if a system access is created with createSystemAccess(…, …, true) and within this access the server was created

Return Value

  • empty: std::shared_ptr<IRPCServer>() if the server is not set

virtual std::shared_ptr<IParticipantRequester> getRequester(const std::string &far_participant_server_name) const = 0

get a requester to connect a far_participant_server_name within the default system access depending on the implementation this is used only together with discovery switched on

Return

a requester to request messages from

Parameters

  • [in] far_participant_server_name: name of the far server

virtual std::shared_ptr<ISystemAccess> getSystemAccess(const std::string &system_name = std::string()) const = 0

get the default server with the given name

Return

the server if it does exist. will return default system access, if system_name is empty.

Parameters

  • [in] system_name: name of the server or empty for default interface

Return Value

  • empty: std::shared_ptr<ISystemAccess>() the server if it does not exist

virtual std::shared_ptr<IParticipantRequester> getRequester(const std::string &far_server_url, bool is_url) const = 0

get a requester to connect a server with the full URL

Return

a requester to request messages from

Parameters

  • [in] far_server_url: address of the far server to get a request for

  • [in] is_url: mark the function to be the is_url version (this param will not be used!)

Return Value

  • empty: std::shared_ptr<IRPCRequester>() if it could not be created

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: if url is not supported

  • other: for url parse error

class ISystemAccess
#include <service_bus_intf.h>

the system access may represent one participant within one system.

A participant will only appear within this system if the createServer was called!

Subclassed by SystemAccessBase

Public Functions

virtual fep3::Result createServer(const std::string &server_name, const std::string &server_url) = 0

create a server object The server itself is one access point to the service bus, where services can be registered and unregistered.

Return

if an error occurs the server object of the system access is empty

Remark

if this function is called while a server was already created before, the current server will be release. if creating of the new server fails the server object will be empty.

Parameters

  • [in] server_name: name of the server (within FEP 3 this is the participant name to appear) within one service bus instance this name has to be unique. Usually the implementation should also prevent to create a server with the same name twice within the discovery_network_url (but this depends on the used protocol if this is possible)

  • [in] server_url: address of the server:

    • for http this will be http://localhost:9090 or http://0.0.0.0:9090 to appear in all networks

    • for http this will be http://192.168.1.2:9090 to appear only in http://192.168.1.2.x networks

    • for rti dds this will be rti-dds://fep3_rpc_topic@system_name:23 to appear on domain 23 to use fep3_rpc_topic_system_name as topic on domain 23

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: successfully created

virtual void releaseServer() = 0

releases the server every service connection is stopped!

virtual std::shared_ptr<IParticipantServer> getServer() const = 0

get the participant server with the given name

Return

the server if created already

Return Value

  • empty: std::shared_ptr<IRPCServer>() no server created yet. call createServer before!

virtual std::shared_ptr<IParticipantRequester> getRequester(const std::string &far_participant_name) const = 0

get a requester to request service call at the participant with far_participant_name by within the system access

Remark

the participant must belong to the same system otherwise no communication is possible

Return

a requester to request messages from

Parameters

  • [in] far_participant_name: name of the far server

Return Value

  • empty: std::shared_ptr<IRPCRequester>() if far_participant_name address cannot be retrieved

virtual std::multimap<std::string, std::string> discover(std::chrono::milliseconds timeout) const = 0

discover servers on the given systems address and system name

Return

returns a set of server name/server address pairs

Parameters

  • [in] timeout: the timeout waiting on the discover message answers

virtual std::string getName() const = 0

retrieves the name of the system access (used as system_name)

Return

returns the name of the system access

Public Static Attributes

constexpr const char *const _use_default_url = "use_default_url"

default option for addresses within the functions:

  • ISystemAccess::discover

  • ISystemAccess::createServer

constexpr const char *const _discover_all_systems = "fep3:search_all_systems"

default option for service_discovery of ALL System within the functions:

  • IServiceBus::createSystemAccess

  • will influence the result of ISystemAccess::discover

class ISimulationBus
#include <simulation_bus_intf.h>

Interface for the simulation bus.

Attention

Implementations of this class and subclasses are not necessarily thread safe. Thus, when using this interface, make sure each object is called from a single thread at a time only. There might be some exceptions from this rule explicitly described in the interface methods’ documentation.

Public Functions

virtual bool isSupported(const arya::IStreamType &stream_type) const = 0

Checks if the stream_type is supported by the simulation bus implementation.

Return

true if the stream_type is supported by the simulation bus implementation, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type to be checked

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader> getReader(const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &stream_type) = 0

Gets a reader for data on an input signal of the given static stream_type with the given signal name whose queue capacity is 1.

Note

The reader pre-allocates a sample pool of size 1 for storing incoming samples. Holding strong references to the samples as delivered to the receiver of fep3::arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader::pop or fep3::arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader::reset causes the pool items to be unavailable for further incoming samples. If pool items are still unavailable when samples come in, additional storage will be allocated on the heap, which might lead to system calls and therefore renders the FEP Participant unsuitable for real time environments.

Return

Data reader if succeeded, nullptr otherwise (e. g. if this method has already been called for the signal with the given signal name); unregistration is automatically performed when the data reader is destroyed

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the input signal (must be unique)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of the input signal (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader> getReader(const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &stream_type, size_t queue_capacity) = 0

This is an overloaded member function that gets a reader for data on an input signal with the given signal name whose queue capacity is queue_capacity.

The queue behaves like a FIFO: If the queue is full the oldest sample (according to the samples’ timestamp) will be discarded upon arrival of a new sample.

Note

The reader pre-allocates a sample pool of queue_capacity for storing incoming samples. Holding strong references to the samples as delivered to the receiver of fep3::arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader::pop or fep3::arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader::reset causes the pool items to be unavailable for further incoming samples. If pool items are still unavailable when samples come in, additional storage will be allocated on the heap, which might lead to system calls and therefore renders the FEP Participant unsuitable for real time environments.

Return

Data reader if succeeded, nullptr otherwise (e. g. if this method has already been called for the signal with the given signal name); unregistration is automatically performed when the data reader is destroyed

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the input signal (must be unique)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of the input signal (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The capacity of the queue.

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader> getReader(const std::string &name) = 0

This is an overloaded member function that gets a reader for data on an input signal of dynamic stream type with the given signal name.

Note

Calling this member function renders the FEP Participant unsuitable for real time environments, because a dynamic change of the stream type may require dynamic memory allocation.

Return

Data reader if succeeded, nullptr otherwise (e. g. if this method has already been called for the signal with the given signal name); unregistration is automatically performed when the data reader is destroyed

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the input signal (must be unique)

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReader> getReader(const std::string &name, size_t queue_capacity) = 0

This is an overloaded member function that gets a reader for data on an input signal of dynamic stream type with the given signal name whose queue capacity is queue_capacity.

The queue behaves like a FIFO: If the queue is full the oldest sample (according to the samples’ timestamp) will be discarded upon arrival of a new sample.

Note

Calling this member function renders the FEP Participant unsuitable for real time environments, because a dynamic change of the stream type may require dynamic memory allocation.

Return

Data reader if succeeded, nullptr otherwise (e. g. if this method has already been called for the signal with the given signal name); unregistration is automatically performed when the data reader is destroyed

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the input signal (must be unique)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The capacity of the queue.

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataWriter> getWriter(const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &stream_type) = 0

Gets a writer for data on an output signal of the given static stream_type with the given signal name.

Return

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the output signal (must be unique)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of the output signal (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataWriter> getWriter(const std::string &name, const arya::IStreamType &stream_type, size_t queue_capacity) = 0

This is an overloaded member function that gets a writer for data on an output signal of the given static stream_type with the given signal name whose queue capacity is queue_capacity.

The queue behaves like a FIFO: If the queue is full the oldest sample (according to the samples’ timestamp) will be discarded upon arrival of a new sample.

Return

Data writer if succeeded, nullptr otherwise (e. g. if this method has already been called for the signal with the given signal name)

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the output signal (must be unique)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of the output signal (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The capacity of the queue.

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataWriter> getWriter(const std::string &name) = 0

This is an overloaded member function that gets a writer for data on an output signal of dynamic stream type with the given signal name.

Return

Data writer if succeeded, nullptr otherwise (e. g. if this method has already been called for the signal with the given signal name)

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the output signal (must be unique)

virtual std::unique_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataWriter> getWriter(const std::string &name, size_t queue_capacity) = 0

This is an overloaded member function that gets a writer for data on an output signal of dynamic stream type with the given signal name whose queue capacity is queue_capacity.

The queue behaves like a FIFO: If the queue is full the oldest sample (according to the samples’ timestamp) will be discarded upon arrival of a new sample.

Return

Data writer if succeeded, nullptr otherwise (e. g. if this method has already been called for the signal with the given signal name)

Parameters

  • [in] name: The name of the output signal (must be unique)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The capacity of the queue.

virtual void startBlockingReception(const std::function<void()> &reception_preparation_done_callback) = 0

Starts passing all incoming items to the receivers of the data readers.

See

IDataReader::reset This method registers for reception of incoming data at the transmission layer, prepares for a call to stopBlockingReception and then calls reception_preparation_done_callback. If at least one existing reader has a receiver set via IDataReader::reset, this method blocks until stopBlockingReception is called. Otherwise this method does not block. Use this method to implement “data triggered” behavior. This method is thread-safe against calls to stopBlockingReception.

Note

The receivers of the data readers will be called from within the thread context this method is called from.

Note

To ensure the Simulation Bus is fully prepared for data reception as well as for a call to stopBlockingReception, wait until reception_preparation_done_callback has been called before calling any other method on the Simulation Bus.

Parameters

  • reception_preparation_done_callback: Callback to be called once the reception is prepared

virtual void stopBlockingReception() = 0

Stops all receptions running due to calls of method startBlockingReception.

This causes all blocking calls of method startBlockingReception to return. If there are currently no blocking calls to startBlockingReception, this method does nothing. This method is thread-safe against calls to startBlockingReception.

class IDataReader
#include <simulation_bus_intf.h>

Class providing access to input data.

See

fep3::ISimulationBus::getReader

Subclassed by SimulationBus::DataReader

Public Functions

virtual ~IDataReader()

DTOR.

virtual size_t size() const = 0

Gets the current size of the item queue.

Return

The current size of the item queue

virtual size_t capacity() const = 0

Gets the current capacity of the item queue.

Return

The current capacity of the item queue

virtual bool pop(arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReceiver &receiver) = 0

Pops the front item from the reader queue (if not empty) and passes it to the callback of receiver.

This method is non-blocking.

Remark

If “data triggered” reception is currently running (see methods reset, ISimulationBus::startBlockingReception and ISimulationBus::stopBlockingReception) the reader queue is always empty because incoming data will immediately be passed to the “data triggered” receivers.

Return

true if an item has been popped, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] receiver: The receiver object to be called back if an item is in the reader queue

virtual void reset(const std::shared_ptr<arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReceiver> &receiver = {}) = 0

Resets the receiver for “data triggered” data reception of this data reader to the passed receiver.

When ISimulationBus::startBlockingReception is called, all incoming items will be passed to the receiver.

Note

The receiver will be called from within the thread context ISimulationBus::startBlockingReception is called from.

Parameters

  • [in] receiver: Shared pointer to the receiver to pass all incoming items to. If empty “data triggered” reception is deactivated for this reader, otherwise the reader takes ownership of the receiver and all incoming items for this data reader will be reported to the receiver when ISimulationBus::startBlockingReception is called.

virtual arya::Optional<arya::Timestamp> getFrontTime() const = 0

Gets the time of the front item in the reader queue.

Return

The timestamp of the front item, if at least one item is in the reader queue, empty optional otherwise

class IDataWriter
#include <simulation_bus_intf.h>

Class providing data transmission facilities.

See

fep3::ISimulationBus::getWriter

Subclassed by SimulationBus::DataWriter

Public Functions

virtual ~IDataWriter()

DTOR.

virtual fep3::Result write(const arya::IDataSample &data_sample) = 0

Copies the content of the data_sample into the transmit buffer.

Return

ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

Parameters

  • [in] data_sample: The data sample to copy the content from

Return Value

  • ERR_UNEXPECTED: An unexpected error occurred.

  • ERR_MEMORY: The transmit buffer’s memory is not suitable to hold the data_sample's content.

  • ERR_NOT_IMPL: There is no functioning implementation of this method.

  • ERR_NOT_CONNECTED: The data writer is not connected to a transmit buffer.

virtual fep3::Result write(const arya::IStreamType &stream_type) = 0

This is an overloaded member function that copies the content of the stream_type into the transmit buffer.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise (see above)

Parameters

  • [in] stream_type: T stream type to copy the content from

virtual fep3::Result transmit() = 0

Transmits the content of the transmit buffer.

This method blocks until all content of the transmit buffer has been transmitted.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

Return Value

  • ERR_UNEXPECTED: An unexpected error occurred.

  • ERR_NOT_IMPL: There is no functioning implementation of this method.

  • ERR_NOT_CONNECTED: The data writer is not connected to a transmission resource.

  • ERR_FAILED: The transmission failed.

class JobConfiguration
#include <job_configuration.h>

Configuration of a job.

Public Types

enum TimeViolationStrategy

Strategy enum configuring behavior in case of an operational time violation.

Values:

unknown = 0

dummy value

ignore_runtime_violation

Time violations are ignored.

warn_about_runtime_violation

A warning will be logged when an operational time violation is detected.

skip_output_publish

Configured output samples will not be published when an operational time violation is detected.

Public Functions

JobConfiguration(arya::Duration cycle_sim_time, arya::Duration first_delay_sim_time = arya::Duration(0), arya::Optional<arya::Duration> max_runtime_real_time = {}, TimeViolationStrategy runtime_violation_strategy = TimeViolationStrategy::ignore_runtime_violation)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] cycle_sim_time: The cycle time to be used for the job (simulation time)

  • [in] first_delay_sim_time: The cycle delay time to the 0 point of the time base (simulation time)

  • [in] max_runtime_real_time: The maximum duration that a single job execution is expected to need for computation (real time). Provide no value if you have no expectations on the job’s runtime.

  • [in] runtime_violation_strategy: The violation strategy

std::string toString() const

Return the configured time violation strategy as string.

Return

The configured time violation strategy as std::string.

Public Members

arya::Duration _cycle_sim_time

The cycle time to be used for the job (simulation time)

arya::Duration _delay_sim_time

The cycle delay time to the 0 point of the time base (simulation time)

arya::Optional<arya::Duration> _max_runtime_real_time

The maximum duration that a single job execution is expected to need for computation (real time)

TimeViolationStrategy _runtime_violation_strategy

The strategy that will be applied in case of a longer computation time than expected.

Public Static Functions

static TimeViolationStrategy fromString(const std::string &strategy_string)

Return a time violation strategy for a given string.

The string parameter must match one of the time violation strategy names. In case of no match, the unknown strategy is returned.

Return

Tiolation strategy matching the provided string.

Parameters

  • [in] strategy_string: The string to derive a time violation strategy from.

static std::string toString(const TimeViolationStrategy &runtime_violation_strategy)

Return a time violation strategy as string for a given strategy.

Return

The configured time violation strategy as std::string.

Parameters

  • [in] runtime_violation_strategy: The strategy to derive a string from.

template<typename type>
class Optional
#include <fep3_optional.h>

Optional class.

Remark

The interface is partly compatible with std::optional as introduced in C++17. The functionality significantly differs from std::optional, e. g. an object of type type exists as long as the instance of this class exists, even if the instance of this class has no value

Template Parameters

  • type: The type of the (optional) value

Public Types

using value_type = type

Alias for the type of the contained value.

Public Functions

constexpr Optional()

CTOR constructing an optional that has no value.

constexpr Optional(const Optional &other)

CTOR constructing an optional by copying from other optional.

Parameters

  • [in] other: The other value to take the value from

template<typename other_type>
constexpr Optional(const Optional<other_type> &other)

CTOR constructing an optional by copying from other optional.

Template Parameters

  • other_type: The type of the other optional value

Parameters

  • [in] other: The other value to take the value from

constexpr Optional(Optional &&other)

CTOR constructing an optional by moving from other optional.

Parameters

  • [in] other: The other value to take the value from

template<typename other_type>
constexpr Optional(Optional<other_type> &&other)

CTOR constructing an optional by moving from other optional.

Template Parameters

  • other_type: The type of the other optional value

Parameters

  • [in] other: The other value to take the value from

template<typename other_value_type = value_type, std::enable_if_t<std::is_assignable<type&, other_value_type>::value, int> = 0>
constexpr Optional(other_value_type &&other_value)

CTOR constructing an optional that has other_value as value.

Template Parameters

  • other_value_type: The type of the other value

Parameters

  • [in] other_value: The other value to be used as value

~Optional()

DTOR.

Assigns other to this.

Return

Reference to this

Parameters

  • [in] other: Other optional to assign from

template<typename other_type>
Optional &operator=(const Optional<other_type> &other)

Assigns other to this.

Return

Reference to this

Template Parameters

  • other_type: The type of other

Parameters

  • [in] other: Other optional to assign from

Optional &operator=(Optional &&other)

Assigns other to this.

Return

Reference to this

Parameters

  • [in] other: Other optional to move assign from

template<typename other_type>
Optional &operator=(Optional<other_type> &&other)

Assigns other to this.

Return

Reference to this

Template Parameters

  • other_type: The type of other

Parameters

  • [in] other: Other optional to move assign from

template<typename other_value_type = value_type, std::enable_if_t<std::is_assignable<type&, other_value_type>::value, int> = 0>
Optional &operator=(other_value_type &&other_value)

Assigns other_value the value of to this.

Return

Reference to this

Template Parameters

  • other_value_type: The type of the other value

Parameters

  • [in] other_value: The other value to assign to the value of this

Dereferences the value.

Return

Dereferences the value.

Return

Checks if this has a value.

constexpr bool has_value() const

Checks if this has a value.

Return

true if this has a value, false otherwise

type &value() &

Returns a reference to the value.

Return

Reference to the value

Exceptions

  • BadOptionalAccess: if this has no value

constexpr const type &value() const &

Returns a const reference to the value.

Return

Const reference to the value

Exceptions

  • BadOptionalAccess: if this has no value

type &&value() &&

Returns an rvalue reference to the value.

Return

Rvalue reference to the value

Exceptions

  • BadOptionalAccess: if this has no value

Returns a const rvalue reference to the value.

Return

Const rvalue reference to the value

Exceptions

  • BadOptionalAccess: if this has no value

class Participant
#include <participant.h>

class declaring a Participant

The participant embeds an Element into the FEP context and will provide a access point to the service bus and simulation bus.

Public Functions

Deleted copy CTOR.

Participant &operator=(const Participant&)

Return

Reference to this

Return

Reference to this

virtual ~Participant()

DTOR.

Return

Template Parameters

  • T: Type of the component to get

int exec(const std::function<void()> &start_up_callback = nullptr)

Blocking call to execute this participant.

Return

int value to return to stdout if wanted

Parameters

  • [in] start_up_callback: optional parameter if the startup is done

Return Value

  • 0: successful and peaceful shutdown of participant reached

namespace detail

FEP 3 SDK namespace for helper and implementation utilities.

Do not directly use them in your code!

namespace base

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace for base functionality and helper classes can be used for convenience.

FEP 3 SDK Libraries namespace for base functionality and helper classes can be used for convenience.

namespace arya

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for base functionality or helper classes introduced in version 3.0.

FEP 3 SDK Libraries version namespace for base functionality or helper classes introduced in version 3.0.

Typedefs

template<typename T>
using PropertyVariable = arya::PropertyValueWithObserver<T>

PropertyVariable as property observer.

Template Parameters

  • T: Type of property variable

using NativePropertyNode = arya::PropertyNode<base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess>

Native implementation of fep3::arya::IPropertyNode.

Functions

fep3::Result addDataIn(fep3::arya::IDataRegistry &data_registry, std::unique_ptr<fep3::arya::IDataRegistry::IDataReader> &reader, const std::string &name, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &stream_type, size_t queue_capacity = 1)

Helper function to register data to a given registry and create a reader immediately.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, otherwise error code indicating occurred error

Parameters

  • [inout] data_registry: The data registry to register the incoming data to

  • [out] reader: The returned reference is only valid when the function returns ERR_NOERROR

  • [in] name: The name of the incoming data (must be unique)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of this data (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The maximum number of items that the reader queue can hold at a time

fep3::Result addDataOut(fep3::arya::IDataRegistry &data_registry, std::unique_ptr<fep3::arya::IDataRegistry::IDataWriter> &writer, const std::string &name, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &stream_type, size_t queue_capacity = 0)

Helper function to register data to a given registry and create a writer immediately.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, otherwise error code indicating occurred error

Parameters

  • [inout] data_registry: The data registry to register the outgoing data to

  • [out] writer: The returned reference is only valid when the function returns ERR_NOERROR

  • [in] name: The name of the outgoing data (must be unique)

  • [in] stream_type: The stream type of this data (see fep3::arya::IStreamType)

  • [in] queue_capacity: The maximum number of items that the transmit queue can hold at a time.

fep3::Result removeDataIn(fep3::arya::IDataRegistry &data_registry, const std::string &name)

Helper function to remove a data reader from a given registry.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

Parameters

  • [in] data_registry: The data registry to remove the data reader from

  • [in] name: The name of the data reader

Return Value

  • fep3::ERR_NOT_FOUND: No data reader with this name found

fep3::Result removeDataOut(fep3::arya::IDataRegistry &data_registry, const std::string &name)

Helper function to remove a data writer from a given registry.

Return

fep3::Result ERR_NOERROR if succeeded, error code otherwise:

Parameters

  • [in] data_registry: The data registry to remove the data writer from

  • [in] name: The name of the data writer

Return Value

  • fep3::ERR_NOT_FOUND: No data writer with this name found

void validatePropertyName(const std::string &property_name)

Validate the given property_name.

A regex is used to validate the name.

Parameters

  • [in] property_name: Name of the property

template<typename T>
fep3::Result setPropertyValue(fep3::arya::IPropertyNode &property_node, T value)

Set the value of the property_node to value in a typed way.

The value will be converted to string and stored in this property_node. By default only these types are supported: fep3::base::arya::PropertyType<T>.

Return

fep3::Result

Template Parameters

  • T: Type of the property_node

Parameters

  • [in] property_node: Node to set the value for

  • [in] value: The value to set

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: if property_node is of different type than T and no conversion is implemented

template<typename T>
fep3::Result setPropertyValue(fep3::arya::IConfigurationService &config_service, const std::string &property_path, T value)

Set the value for a property node with this property_path in a typed way.

The provided configuration service will be searched for the property with property_path. See setPropertyValue(fep3::arya::IPropertyNode&, T) for details about the value to be set.

Return

fep3::Result

Template Parameters

  • T: Type of the property with path property_path.

Parameters

  • [in] config_service: The configuration service of the fep element

  • [in] property_path: The property path of the property as registered with the config_service (e.g. Clock/CycleTime).

  • [in] value: The value to set

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: if no property with this property_path was found

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: if property property_path is of different type than T and no conversion is implemented

template<typename T>
T getPropertyValue(const fep3::arya::IPropertyNode &property_node)

Get the value of the property_node in a typed way.

If the property value cannot be represented by T a default value is returned. See implementation of fep3::base::arya::DefaultPropertyTypeConversion<T>::fromString() for used T. By default only these types are supported: fep3::base::arya::PropertyType<T>.

Return

Value of type T

Template Parameters

  • T: Type of the property_node

Parameters

  • [in] property_node: Property to get value from

template<typename T>
fep3::arya::Optional<T> getPropertyValue(const fep3::arya::IConfigurationService &config_service, const std::string &property_path)

Get the value of the property node with property_path in a typed way.

The provided configuration service will be searched for the property node. See fep3::base::arya::getPropertyValue(const fep3::arya::IPropertyNode&) for detail.

Return

If the node cannot be found, an empty fep3::arya::Optional<T> is returned

Template Parameters

  • T: Type of the property with property_path.

Parameters

  • [in] config_service: The configuration service of the fep element

  • [in] property_path: Path of the property (e.g. Clock/CycleTime).

bool isSupportedMetaType(const std::vector<arya::StreamMetaType> &supported_list, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &type)

Helper function to check if the given stream type is part of the given list with streammetatypes.

The given type is supported if its metatype is part of the given metatype list.

Return

true if the type is supported, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] supported_list: list of metatypes to check

  • [in] type: stream_type to check if it is part of the supported list.

Variables

const std::string meta_type_prop_name_datatype = "datatype"

value to define the plain type within the meta_type_plain and meta_type_plain_array

const std::string meta_type_prop_name_max_array_size = "max_array_size"

value to define max array amount within all array stream types

const std::string meta_type_prop_name_max_byte_size = "max_byte_size"

value to define max byte size of a stream type

const StreamMetaType meta_type_plain = {"plain-ctype", std::list<std::string>{meta_type_prop_name_datatype}}

the meta type for plain old datatype

name: “plain-ctype” properties: “datatype”

See

StreamTypePlain

const StreamMetaType meta_type_plain_array = {"plain-array-ctype", std::list<std::string>{meta_type_prop_name_datatype, meta_type_prop_name_max_array_size}}

the meta type for plain old datatype as array

name: “plain-array-ctype” properties: “datatype”, “max_array_size”

See

StreamTypePlain

const StreamMetaType meta_type_string = {"ascii-string", std::list<std::string>{meta_type_prop_name_max_byte_size}}

the meta type for strings

name: “ascii-string” properties: “max_array_size”

const StreamMetaType meta_type_video = {"video", std::list<std::string>{"height", "width", "pixelformat", meta_type_prop_name_max_byte_size}}

the meta type for video

name: “video” properties: “max_byte_size”, “height”, “width”, “pixelformat”

the meta type for audio

name: “audio” properties: “max_byte_size”

const StreamMetaType meta_type_raw = {"anonymous", std::list<std::string>{}}

the meta type for raw memory types which are not typed!!

name: “anonymous” properties:

See

StreamTypeRaw

const std::string meta_type_prop_name_ddlstruct = "ddlstruct"

value to define the struct type within the meta_type_ddl

const std::string meta_type_prop_name_ddldescription = "ddldescription"

value to define the whole type definition within the meta_type_ddl

const std::string meta_type_prop_name_ddlfileref = "ddlfileref"

value to define a file reference to the whole type definition within the meta_type_ddl

const StreamMetaType meta_type_ddl_fileref = {"ddl-fileref", std::list<std::string>{meta_type_prop_name_ddlstruct, meta_type_prop_name_ddlfileref}}

Meta type for structured memory types which are described by DDL.

Description has to be loaded from a file.

name: “ddl-fileref” properties: “ddlstruct”, “ddlfileref”

See

meta_type_prop_name_ddlstruct, meta_type_prop_name_ddlfileref

See

StreamTypeDDLFileRef

const StreamMetaType meta_type_ddl = {"ddl", std::list<std::string>{meta_type_prop_name_ddlstruct, meta_type_prop_name_ddldescription}}

Meta type for structured memory types which are described by DDL.

Description is shipped within a StreamType property.

name: “ddl” properties: “ddlstruct”, “ddldescription”

See

meta_type_prop_name_ddlstruct, meta_type_prop_name_ddldescription

See

StreamTypeDDL

name: “ddl” properties: “ddlstruct”, “ddlfileref”, “max_array_size”

class ClockBase : public IClock
#include <clock_base.h>

Base implementation of a Clock.

Subclassed by ContinuousClock, DiscreteClock

Public Functions

ClockBase(const std::string &clock_name)

CTOR.

A ClockBase is initialized with a current time of 0.

Parameters

  • [in] clock_name: Name of the clock

ClockBase(const ClockBase &other)

Delete copy CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] other: ClockBase to copy from

Delete move CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] other: ClockBase to move from

Delete copy assignment operator.

Return

ClockBase

Parameters

  • [in] other: ClockBase to copy from

ClockBase &operator=(ClockBase &&other)

Delete move assignment operator.

Return

ClockBase

Parameters

  • [in] other: ClockBase to move from

virtual ~ClockBase()

DTOR.

std::string getName() const

Get the Name of the clock.

Return

Name of the clock

void start(const std::weak_ptr<fep3::arya::IClock::IEventSink> &event_sink)

Start the clock.

Remark

The reset events IEventSink::timeResetBegin and IEventSink::timeResetEnd will be emitted to event_sink.

Remark

If event_sink is a IClock::ClockType::discrete also the events IEventSink::timeUpdateBegin, IEventSink::timeUpdating, IEventSink::timeUpdateEnd will be emitted to event_sink.

Parameters

  • [in] event_sink: The event sink to emit time reset and time updating events to.

void stop()

Stop the clock.

Usually the clock will reset immediately (still depending on the implementation).

Gets the component ready for running state.

fep3::Result relax()

Makes the component falling back to a simple initialized state Relax is the antonym of tense.

Return

fep3::Result

Result deinitialize()

Deinitializes the component.

Return

fep3::Result

fep3::Result start()

Starts the component.

Return

fep3::Result

Stops the component.

Return

class Configuration
#include <propertynode.h>

Component configuration base class.

Subclassed by ElementConfigurable, DataJob

Public Functions

Configuration(const std::string &root_node_name)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] root_node_name: Name of the configuration root property node

virtual ~Configuration()

DTOR.

void updatePropertyVariables() const

Update all registered property variables of the root property node.

fep3::Result initConfiguration(fep3::arya::IConfigurationService &configuration_service)

Inittializes the configuration by calling the convenience function registerPropertyVariables and adding the local property node to the configuration service.

Remark

this function will store a local pointer to the given configuration_service to call unregistering while deinitConfiguration

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] configuration_service: the configuration service to register the property node to

void deinitConfiguration()

deinitializes the configuration by unregistering the property node from the local pointer given in configuration_service while initConfiguration it will also call the unregisterPropertyVariables

Return

fep3::Result

template<typename variable_type>
fep3::Result registerPropertyVariable(PropertyVariable<variable_type> &property_variable, const std::string &name = "")

Register a property variable for this property node.

The property variable allows typed read access to this property. It is updated on every call of fep3::base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess::updateObservers(). Changing the property variable does not lead to a change to the actual property, except for the time of registration, when the property will be set to the value of property_variable.

Return

fep3::Result

Template Parameters

  • variable_type: Type of the property_variable

Parameters

  • [in] property_variable: The property variable to register as observer for the property

  • [in] name: The name of the property to register to. If empty the property variable will register to this node, otherwise to a child with this name. If a child with name does not exist, it will be created

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: if the property to register to already exist and has a different type than the property variable

template<typename variable_type>
fep3::Result unregisterPropertyVariable(PropertyVariable<variable_type> &property_variable, const std::string &name = "")

Unregister a property variable from this property node.

Return

fep3::Result

Template Parameters

  • variable_type: Type of the property_variable

Parameters

  • [in] property_variable: Property variable to unregister

  • [in] name: Name of the property variable If empty the property variable will unregister from this node, otherwise from a child with this name.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: if property with name was not found

virtual fep3::Result registerPropertyVariables()

Register property variables at the root property node.

Override this add properties and property variables to the root node by calling registerPropertyVariable

Return

fep3::Result

virtual fep3::Result unregisterPropertyVariables()

Unregister property variables at the root property node.

Override this to unregister property variables from the root node by calling registerPropertyVariable

Return

fep3::Result

std::shared_ptr<NativePropertyNode> getNode() const

gets the property node which will also be registered at the configuration service

Return

std::shared_ptr<base::NativePropertyNode> the node

class ContinuousClock : public ClockBase
#include <clock_base.h>

Base implementation for a continuous clock which will automatically call the arya::IClock::IEventSink for you.

You have to implement following functionality:

  • CTOR

  • ContinuousClock::getNewTime

  • ContinuousClock::resetTime

Public Functions

ContinuousClock(const std::string &name)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the clock

class DataSample : public DataSampleBase, public IRawMemory
#include <data_sample.h>

Implementation helper class for a data sample used within ISimulationBus or IDataRegistry.

Public Functions

DataSample()

Construct a new data sample.

DataSample(size_t pre_allocated_capacity, bool fixed_size)

Construct a new data sample.

Parameters

  • [in] pre_allocated_capacity: will preallocate the raw memory data area of the data sample

  • [in] fixed_size: marks the sample to have no dynamic memory. if capacity size is reached no reallocation is possible.

DataSample(fep3::arya::Timestamp time, uint32_t counter, const fep3::arya::IRawMemory &from_memory)

Construct a new data sample.

Parameters

  • [in] time: preset timestamp

  • [in] counter: preset counter

  • [in] from_memory: the memory to copy the content from

Parameters

  • [in] other: the sample to copy from

DataSample& the copied sample content

set the content of the sample

Return

size_t the size copied

Parameters

  • [in] time: timestamp

  • [in] counter: counter of the sample

  • [in] from_memory: the memory to copy from

size_t capacity() const

Gets the capacity of the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

const void *cdata() const

Gets the raw pointer to the memory.

Return

const void* The pointer

size_t size() const

Gets the size of the current stored value in the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

size_t set(const void *data, size_t data_size)

Resets the memory of the raw pointer.

Return

size_t The size in bytes that were copied (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data: The data to set

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to set

size_t resize(size_t data_size)

Resizes the memory.

Return

size_t The new size in bytes (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to resize

size_t getSize() const

Get the Size of the data in bytes.

Return

size_t The size of the data in bytes

size_t read(fep3::arya::IRawMemory &writeable_memory) const

Calls the IRawMemory::set function to copy the memory content of the sample to the given writeable_memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in byte which are copied (usually it’s the return value of fep3::IRawMemory::set)

Parameters

  • [out] writeable_memory: The memory to copy the memory to (the callback to copy is the fep3::IRawMemory::set call)

size_t write(const fep3::arya::IRawMemory &readable_memory)

Changes and copies the given memory to the sample’s internal memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in bytes that were copied

Parameters

  • [in] readable_memory: The memory to copy (uses fep3::IRawMemory::cdata and fep3::IRawMemory::size to obtain)

class DataSampleBase : public IDataSample
#include <data_sample.h>

Abstract base class for a data sample providing time and counter functionality.

Return

The timestamp of this data sample

uint32_t getCounter() const

Gets the counter value.

Return

The counter value of this data sample

void setTime(const fep3::arya::Timestamp &time)

Sets the timestamp.

Parameters

  • [in] time: The timestamp to be set

void setCounter(uint32_t counter)

Sets the counter.

Parameters

  • [in] counter: The counter value to be set

struct DataSampleRawMemoryRef : public IDataSample
#include <data_sample.h>

Data sample helper class to wrap a raw memory pointer data and a size data_size in bytes.

Public Functions

DataSampleRawMemoryRef(fep3::arya::Timestamp &time, const void *data, size_t data_size)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [inout] time: the timestamp to preset

  • [in] data: the data pointer to reference to

  • [in] data_size: the size of the memory given in data

template<typename T, typename is_standard_layout_type = void>
class DataSampleType : public DataSampleBase, public RawMemoryClassType<T>
#include <data_sample.h>

Data sample helper template to wrap a non-standard layout type T by default.

Template Parameters

  • T: the non-standard layout type

  • is_standard_layout_type: the standard layout type check

Public Types

typedef T value_type

the value type is T

typedef arya::RawMemoryClassType<T> base_type

the base type is the super class

Public Functions

DataSampleType(value_type &other)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] other: the other to copy from

DataSampleType &operator=(const DataSampleType &other)

Copy assignment.

Return

this type of sample

Parameters

  • [in] other: the other to copy from

DataSampleType &operator=(const fep3::arya::IDataSample &other)

Assignment from another sample.

Return

this type of sample

Parameters

  • [in] other: the other to copy from

size_t getSize() const

Get the Size of the data in bytes.

Return

size_t The size of the data in bytes

size_t read(fep3::arya::IRawMemory &writeable_memory) const

Calls the IRawMemory::set function to copy the memory content of the sample to the given writeable_memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in byte which are copied (usually it’s the return value of fep3::IRawMemory::set)

Parameters

  • [out] writeable_memory: The memory to copy the memory to (the callback to copy is the fep3::IRawMemory::set call)

size_t write(const fep3::arya::IRawMemory &readable_memory)

Changes and copies the given memory to the sample’s internal memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in bytes that were copied

Parameters

  • [in] readable_memory: The memory to copy (uses fep3::IRawMemory::cdata and fep3::IRawMemory::size to obtain)

#include <data_sample.h>

this sample type

Parameters
