class DiscreteClock : public ClockBase
#include <clock_base.h>

Base implementation for a discrete clock which will automatically call the IClock::IEventSink for you.

You have to implement following functionality:

  • CTOR

While using you only call

DiscreteClock::setNewTime and DiscreteClock::setResetTime

Public Functions

DiscreteClock(const std::string &name)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the clock

void setNewTime(const fep3::arya::Timestamp new_time, const bool send_update_before_after) const

Set a new time for the clock.

Emit time update events via the event sink. Reset the clock if setNewTime has been called for the first time or if new_time is smaller than the current time

Parameters

  • [in] new_time: The new time of the clock

  • [in] send_update_before_after: Flag indicates whether IClock::IEventSink::timeUpdateBegin and IClock::IEventSink::timeUpdateEnd events should be emitted. The event IClock::IEventSink::timeUpdating is always emitted.

void setResetTime(const fep3::arya::Timestamp new_time) const

Set a new time for the clock and emit time reset events via the event sink.

Parameters

  • [in] new_time: The new time of the clock

class EasyLogging
#include <easy_logger.h>

Easy helper class for logging.

Derive from this class to use the logging macros:

  • FEP3_LOG_DEBUG

  • FEP3_LOG_FATAL

  • FEP3_LOG_ERROR

  • FEP3_LOG_WARNING

  • FEP3_LOG_INFO

  • FEP3_LOG_RESULT

Use as follows: 

class MyComponent : public base::EasyLogging
{
//...
    fep3::Result someInitMethod()
    {
        return initLogger("component.my_use_of_easy_logger",*getComponents());
    }
     fep3::Result someDeinitMethod()
    {
        return deinitLogger();
    }
};

Subclassed by ElementBase, DataJob

Public Functions

fep3::Result initLogger(const fep3::arya::IComponents &components, const std::string &logger_name)

retrieves the logging service and creates a logger to log to

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] components: the components where the ILoggingService is registered to

  • [in] logger_name: the name of the logger

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: if succeeded

  • ERR_UNEXPECTED: if the creation of logger fails

void deinitLogger()

deinit the logger and reset the logger member

std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::ILogger> getLogger() const

Get the Logger object created while initLogger.

Return

std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::ILogger>

class IPropertyObservable
#include <propertynode.h>

Interface for registration of a fep3::base::arya::IPropertyObserver.

Subclassed by IPropertyWithExtendedAccess

Public Functions

virtual void registerObserver(std::weak_ptr<arya::IPropertyObserver> observer) = 0

Register the observer.

Parameters

  • [in] observer: Observer to register. After registration the observer will be called whenever the property it registered for is changed.

virtual void unregisterObserver(std::weak_ptr<arya::IPropertyObserver> observer) = 0

Unregister the observer.

Parameters

  • [in] observer: Observer to unregister.

class IPropertyObserver
#include <propertynode.h>

Interface for receiving notifications about changes of a property node.

Subclassed by PropertyValueWithObserver< T >, PropertyValueWithObserver< T >::ObserverForwarder

Public Functions

virtual void onUpdate(fep3::arya::IPropertyNode &updated_property) = 0

Method to be called whenever a property is updated.

Parameters

  • [in] updated_property: PropertyNode that was updated. It contains the value after the update.

class IPropertyWithExtendedAccess : public IPropertyNode, public IPropertyObservable
#include <propertynode.h>

Extends fep3::arya::IPropertyNode with additional functionality.

Public Functions

virtual std::shared_ptr<IPropertyWithExtendedAccess> setChild(std::shared_ptr<IPropertyWithExtendedAccess> property_to_add) = 0

Sets the child node property_to_add.

If a child with the same name as property_to_add already exists, it will be overridden.

Return

The child that was just set

Parameters

  • [in] property_to_add: Property to be set as child

virtual std::shared_ptr<IPropertyWithExtendedAccess> getChildImpl(const std::string &name) = 0

Get the child with this name.

In contrary to fep3::arya::IPropertyNode::getChild() this method will return the interface fep3::base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess(), which allows some more modification to the child.

Return

Child as shared_ptr or

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child

Return Value

  • Default: constructed shared_ptr, if child was not found.

virtual void updateObservers() = 0

Update all observers that registered to this property node.

Due to synchronization, observers will only be updated if this method is called.

virtual void copyDeepFrom(const fep3::arya::IPropertyNode &other) = 0

Deep copies the content of other node to this node.

The children of other are also copied. Observers won’t be copied.

Parameters

  • [in] other: Node to copy from

void registerObserver(std::weak_ptr<arya::IPropertyObserver> observer) = 0

Register an observer to this node.

All observers are notified when the method fep3::base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess::updateObservers() is called.

Parameters

  • [in] observer: Observer to register

void unregisterObserver(std::weak_ptr<arya::IPropertyObserver> observer) = 0

Unregister an observer from this node.

Parameters

  • [in] observer: Observer to unregister

virtual void removeChild(const std::string &name) = 0

Remove the child with name.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child to remove

template<class T = fep3::arya::IProperties>
class Properties : public T
#include <properties.h>

Implementation class to represent a typed key value list.

Template Parameters

  • T: the property interface

Public Functions

bool setProperty(const std::string &name, const std::string &value, const std::string &type)

sets the value and type of the given property.

If the property does not exist it will add one. If the type is different, than the existing one it will change it.

Return

true if the value could be set, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the property (this is not a path, a single name)

  • [in] value: the value as string

  • [in] type: the string description of the type There are more types possible than the default types: fep3::base::arya::PropertyType

std::string getProperty(const std::string &name) const

gets the property value as string

Return

std::string the value as string you may determine the type by using getPropertyType

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the property

std::string getPropertyType(const std::string &name) const

gets the property value

Return

std::string the type of the property. default types are define by fep3::base::arya::PropertyType

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the property

bool isEqual(const fep3::arya::IProperties &properties) const

compares this key value list with the given properties instance the properties are equal if each property of this will have the same value within properties

Return

true if each property of this have the same value within properties, false otherweise

Parameters

  • [in] properties: the properties instance to compare to

void copyTo(fep3::arya::IProperties &properties) const

assignment helper

Parameters

  • [inout] properties: properties to copy values of this property object to

std::vector<std::string> getPropertyNames() const

returns a list of all property names of this node

Return

vector of property names

std::vector<std::string> getPropertyValues() const

returns a list of all property values of this node

Return

vector of property values

std::vector<std::string> getPropertyTypes() const

returns a list of all property types of this node

Return

vector of property types

template<typename T>
class PropertyNode : public T
#include <propertynode.h>

Implementation class to represent a property tree node T can either be fep3::arya::IPropertyNode or fep3::base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess.

Public Functions

PropertyNode(const std::string &name, const std::string &value, const std::string &type)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the property node

  • [in] value: Initial value of the property node

  • [in] type: Type of the property node

    • See fep3::base::arya::PropertyType<T>::getTypeName for default types.

PropertyNode(std::string name)

CTOR for a property Node of type fep3::base::arya::NodePropertyType which represents a node without value.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the property node

PropertyNode(const PropertyNode &other)

Copy CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] other: Node to copy from

PropertyNode &operator=(const PropertyNode &other)

Copy assignment operator.

Return

PropertyNode&

Parameters

  • [in] other: Node to copy from

void copyDeepFrom(const fep3::arya::IPropertyNode &other)

Deep copies the content of other node to this node.

The children of other are also copied. Observers won’t be copied.

Parameters

  • [in] other: Node to copy from

std::string getValue() const

Get the current value of the node as string.

Return

Current value of node as std::string

std::string getName() const

Get the name of the node.

Return

Name of node

std::string getTypeName() const

Get the type name of the node.

See fep3::base::arya::PropertyType<T>::getTypeName for default types.

Return

Type name of node

fep3::Result setValue(const std::string &value, const std::string &type_name = "")

Set the value of the node to value.

If a type_name is provided it has to be either equal to the type name of this node, or the implementation has to provide an internal conversion. If no conversion is provided an error will be returned.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] value: The value to set for the node as std::string

  • [in] type_name: The type, the value represents. Default value is “”.

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: if type_name is different than the type name of this node and no conversion is provided.

void updateObservers()

Update all observers that registered to this property node.

Due to synchronization, observers will only be updated if this method is called.

bool isEqual(const fep3::arya::IPropertyNode &other) const

Compare the node with other for equality.

Comparison will be done for the nodes as well as all the children. Value, type and name have to be equal.

Return

true if equal, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] other: Node to compare this node with

void reset()

Reset this node itself and all its children.

The reset will change the value to the value at creation.

std::vector<std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IPropertyNode>> getChildren() const

Get all children of the node.

Return

Vector of children

std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IPropertyNode> getChild(const std::string &name) const

Get the child with the name name.

Return

Shared pointer to child with name name

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child to look for

Return Value

  • Empty: std::shared_ptr<IPropertyNode> if child was not found

void registerObserver(std::weak_ptr<arya::IPropertyObserver> observer)

Register an observer to this node.

All observers are notified when the method fep3::base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess::updateObservers() is called.

Parameters

  • [in] observer: Observer to register

void unregisterObserver(std::weak_ptr<arya::IPropertyObserver> observer)

Unregister an observer from this node.

Parameters

  • [in] observer: Observer to unregister

size_t getNumberOfChildren() const

Get the number of children of this node.

Return

Number of children

bool isChild(const std::string &name) const

Check whether name is a child of this node.

Return

true if name is a child of this node, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child

void removeChild(const std::string &name)

Remove the child with name.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child to remove

virtual std::shared_ptr<T> getChildImpl(const std::string &name)

Get the child with this name.

In contrary to fep3::arya::IPropertyNode::getChild() this method will return the interface fep3::base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess(), which allows some more modification to the child.

Return

Child as shared_ptr or

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the child

Return Value

  • Default: constructed shared_ptr, if child was not found.

std::shared_ptr<T> setChild(std::shared_ptr<T> property_to_add)

Sets the child node property_to_add.

If a child with the same name as property_to_add already exists, it will be overridden.

Return

The child that was just set

Parameters

  • [in] property_to_add: Property to be set as child

template<typename variable_type>
fep3::Result registerVariable(PropertyVariable<variable_type> &property_variable, const std::string &name = "")

Register a property variable for this property node.

The property variable allows typed read access to this property. It is updated on every call of fep3::base::arya::IPropertyWithExtendedAccess::updateObservers(). Changing the property variable does not lead to a change to the actual property, except for the time of registration, when the property will be set to the value of property_variable.

Return

fep3::Result

Template Parameters

  • variable_type: Type of the property_variable

Parameters

  • [in] property_variable: The property variable to register as observer for the property

  • [in] name: The name of the property to register to. If empty the property variable will register to this node, otherwise to a child with this name. If a child with name does not exist, it will be created

Return Value

  • ERR_INVALID_TYPE: if the property to register to already exist and has a different type than the property variable

template<typename variable_type>
fep3::Result unregisterVariable(PropertyVariable<variable_type> &property_variable, const std::string &name = "")

Unregister a property variable from this property node.

Return

fep3::Result

Template Parameters

  • variable_type: Type of the property_variable

Parameters

  • [in] property_variable: Property variable to unregister

  • [in] name: Name of the property variable If empty the property variable will unregister from this node, otherwise from a child with this name.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: if property with name was not found

template<typename T>
struct PropertyType
#include <property_type.h>

The property type template can be used to define the type description name within fep3::arya::IProperties.

Template Parameters

  • T: The type to retrieve the type name from. See the default types:

    • PropertyType<bool>

    • PropertyType<int32_t>

    • PropertyType<int64_t>

    • PropertyType<double>

    • PropertyType<std::string>

    • PropertyType<std::vector<bool>>

    • PropertyType<std::vector<int32_t>>

    • PropertyType<std::vector<int64_t>>

    • PropertyType<std::vector<double>>

    • PropertyType<std::vector<std::string>>

Public Static Functions

static std::string getTypeName()

gets the type name for the type T

Return

std::string the type name for the type T

template<>
struct PropertyType<bool>
#include <property_type.h>

template<typename T, typename PROP_TYPE = PropertyType<T>, typename PROP_TYPECONVERSION = DefaultPropertyTypeConversion<T>>
class PropertyValue
#include <property_type.h>

Implementation class to represent a typed value of T can be used for fep3::arya::IProperties.

Template Parameters

  • T: the type

  • PROP_TYPE: the type name type

  • PROP_TYPECONVERSION: the type conversion type to serialize and deserialize to/from a string representation

Public Functions

PropertyValue()

Construct a new Property Value object of type T with default.

PropertyValue(T value)

Construct a new Property Value object of type T.

Parameters

  • [in] value:

std::string getTypeName()

Get the Type name.

Return

std::string the type name in this case described by the type PROP_TYPE

std::string toString() const

converts the value T to a string

Return

std::string the converted value as string in this case described by the type PROP_TYPECONVERSION

operator const T&() const

/**

operator const T&

Return

const T&

bool operator==(const T &other)

operator==

Return

true if equal, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] other: T to compare for equality

bool operator!=(const T &other)

operator!=

Return

true if not equal, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] other: T to compare for unequality

class ObserverForwarder : public IPropertyObserver
#include <propertynode.h>

Forwarder that is used to forward calls to a reference of type fep3::base::arya::IPropertyObserver Is used if an observer cannot be instantiated as shared_ptr directly.

Public Functions

ObserverForwarder(arya::IPropertyObserver &forward_to)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] forward_to: Reference to forward calls to

void onUpdate(fep3::arya::IPropertyNode &updated_property)

Method to be called whenever a property is updated.

Parameters

  • [in] updated_property: PropertyNode that was updated. It contains the value after the update.

template<class T, typename Enable = void>
struct RawMemoryClassType : public IRawMemory
#include <raw_memory.h>

Helper class to wrap up a class type as IRawMemory interface the given class type must provide an interface to access capacity(), size(), cdata(), resize()

Template Parameters

  • T:

  • Enable: check for constness

Public Functions

RawMemoryClassType(T &value)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] value: reference to the representing value

size_t capacity() const

Gets the capacity of the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

const void *cdata() const

Gets the raw pointer to the memory.

Return

const void* The pointer

size_t size() const

Gets the size of the current stored value in the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

no_documentation size_t resize(size_t data_size)

Resizes the memory.

Return

size_t The new size in bytes (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to resize

Public Members

T &_value

reference to the representing value

template<>
struct RawMemoryClassType<const std::string, const std::string> : public IRawMemory
#include <raw_memory.h>

specialized raw memory class type to wrap up a std::string as IRawMemory

Public Types

typedef const std::string T

definition for type string as value type

Public Functions

RawMemoryClassType(T &value)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] value: Reference to the value

size_t capacity() const

Gets the capacity of the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

const void *cdata() const

Gets the raw pointer to the memory.

Return

const void* The pointer

size_t size() const

Gets the size of the current stored value in the memory.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

size_t set(const void *data, size_t data_size)

Resets the memory of the raw pointer.

Return

size_t The size in bytes that were copied (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data: The data to set

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to set

size_t resize(size_t data_size)

Resizes the memory.

Return

size_t The new size in bytes (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to resize

Public Members

T &_value

value reference

template<typename T>
struct RawMemoryClassType<std::vector<T>, void> : public IRawMemory
#include <raw_memory.h>

Specialized raw memory type for the non-standard layout type std::vector.

Public Functions

RawMemoryClassType(std::vector<T> &value)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] value: reference to the std vector which will be wrapped

size_t capacity() const

Returns the preallocated memory of the std vector in bytes.

Return

size_t In bytes

const void *cdata() const

Gets the raw pointer to the memory of the std vector.

Return

const void* The pointer

size_t size() const

Gets the size in memory of all elements.

Return

size_t The size in bytes

size_t set(const void *data, size_t data_size)

Copies the memory of the given std vector.

Return

size_t The size in bytes that were copied (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data: Pointer to c-array of type T

  • [in] data_size: Size in bytes. Equals to element count multiplied by element size

size_t resize(size_t data_size)

Resizes the memory.

Return

size_t The new size in bytes (if not equal to data_size, something went wrong)

Parameters

  • [in] data_size: The size in bytes to resize

Public Members

std::vector<T> &_value

reference to the representing value

class ServiceRegistryBase : public IRPCServer, public IServiceRegistryRPCService
#include <service_registry_base.hpp>

no_documentation

ServiceRegistry Base class to implement the ParticipantInfo within the servicebus implementation This class is only necessary if you want to implement your own IServiceBus::IParticipantServer

If using it, you need to implement to retrieve information for the RPC call:

  • getRegisteredServiceNames

  • getServiceByName And implement for the IParticipantServer:

  • registerService

  • unregisterService

  • getUrl

Public Functions

ServiceRegistryBase(const std::string &name, const std::string &system_name)

Construct a Service Registry Base object.

Parameters

  • name: name of the participant server to register (this will be the IServiceBus::IParticipantServer)

  • system_name: the participants system it belongs to (might change while runtime!!)

fep3::Result initialize()

intializes the RPC ServiceRegistryRPCService and register it

Remark

Unfortunately, this MUST be called separately since virtual functional calls are not possible by a CTOR We could also fake here, that the first registerService call will call also for IRPCParticipantInfoDef!

Return

returns the error values of arya::IServiceBus::IParticipantServer::registerService

std::string getParticipantName() const

retrieve the name of the participant

Return

the name of the participant

std::string getSystemName() const

retrieve the system name the participant belongs to

Return

the system name the participant belongs to

std::string getName() const

Get the name.

Return

std::string the name

void setName(const std::string &name)

Sets the name.

Parameters

  • [in] name: the name

template<typename item_queue_type>
struct SimulationDataAccess
#include <simulation_data_access.h>

Structure containing simulation data access.

Note

This class is meant to be used to implement data triggered simulation data access in a Simulation Bus implementation

Public Members

std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReceiver> _receiver

The receiver receiving new data in data triggered reception.

std::shared_ptr<item_queue_type> _item_queue

The item queue to pop data from.

template<typename item_queue_type>
class SimulationDataAccessCollection : private std::deque<SimulationDataAccess<item_queue_type>>
#include <simulation_data_access.h>

Collection of data access objects to be filled by fep3::ISimulationBus::IDataReader::reset.

Template Parameters

  • item_queue_type: Type of the item queue to be used by the data access collection

Public Types

using const_iterator = typename std::deque::const_iterator

const iterator to an entry of the simulation data access collection

Public Functions

const_iterator add(const std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::ISimulationBus::IDataReceiver> &receiver, const std::shared_ptr<item_queue_type> &item_queue)

Adds the receiver and the item_queue to the data access collection.

Return

Iterator to the added entry

Parameters

  • receiver: The receiver to be added

  • item_queue: The item queue to be added

void remove(const const_iterator &data_receiver_iterator)

Removes an entry from the data access collection.

Parameters

  • data_receiver_iterator: The iterator to the entry to be removed

void clear()

Clears the data access collection.

template<typename T>
class StdVectorSampleType : public RawMemoryClassType<std::vector<T>>, public DataSampleBase
#include <data_sample.h>

Data sample helper template to wrap a std vector of type T.

Public Types

typedef T value_type

value type of DataSampleType

typedef arya::RawMemoryClassType<std::vector<T>> base_type

super type of DataSampleType

Public Functions

StdVectorSampleType(std::vector<value_type> &array)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] array: the data pointer to reference to

StdVectorSampleType &operator=(const fep3::arya::IDataSample &other)

copy assignment

Return

this data sample type object

Parameters

  • [in] other: reference to the value type to copy from

size_t getSize() const

Get the Size of the data in bytes.

Return

size_t The size of the data in bytes

size_t read(fep3::arya::IRawMemory &writeable_memory) const

Calls the IRawMemory::set function to copy the memory content of the sample to the given writeable_memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in byte which are copied (usually it’s the return value of fep3::IRawMemory::set)

Parameters

  • [out] writeable_memory: The memory to copy the memory to (the callback to copy is the fep3::IRawMemory::set call)

size_t write(const fep3::arya::IRawMemory &readable_memory)

Changes and copies the given memory to the sample’s internal memory.

Return

size_t Returns the size in bytes that were copied

Parameters

  • [in] readable_memory: The memory to copy (uses fep3::IRawMemory::cdata and fep3::IRawMemory::size to obtain)

class StreamMetaType
#include <stream_type.h>

Implementation for a Stream Meta Type representation.

This representation contains the name of the meta type and it will also contain a list of properties which are mandatory to describe this kind of meta type

Public Functions

Construct a new Stream Meta Type object.

Return

the streammetatype

Parameters

  • [in] meta_type_name:

Construct a new Stream Meta Type object.

Parameters

  • [in] meta_type_name: the name if the metatype

  • [in] required_properties: a list of required mandatory property names for the metatype

const char *getName() const

Gets the Name of the meta type.

Return

const char* the name of the meta type

compares (only) the names of the meta types

Return

true if the name is equal, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] other: the meta type to compare to

compares (only) the names of the meta types

Return

true if the name is equal, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] other: the meta type to compare to

class StreamType : public Properties<fep3::arya::IStreamType>
#include <stream_type.h>

Representation class of a Stream Meta Type instance This class will represent one instance of a Stream Meta Type.

It will have set the values for the meta types required mandatory properties

See

fep::StreamMetaType

Subclassed by StreamTypeDDL, StreamTypeDDLArray, StreamTypeDDLArrayFileRef, StreamTypeDDLFileRef, StreamTypePlain< T >, StreamTypePlainArray< plain_element_type >, StreamTypeRaw, StreamTypeString

  • [in] meta_type: the metatype the stream type is instantiating

assignment operator

Return

class StreamTypeDDL : public StreamType
#include <default_stream_type.h>

StreamType class for meta_type_ddl.

See

meta_type_ddl

See

StreamTypeDDLFileRef

Public Functions

StreamTypeDDL(const std::string &ddlstruct, const std::string &ddldescription)

Construct a new Stream Type DDL object.

Parameters

  • [in] ddlstruct: Value for ddl struct this StreamType describes

  • [in] ddldescription: Contains the whole ddl description content. Your ddlstruct has to be included in this description.

#include <default_stream_type.h>

See

meta_type_ddl_array

Parameters

  • [in] ddlstruct: An element of your array

  • [in] ddldescription: Contains the whole ddl description content. Your ddlstruct has to be included in this description.

  • [in] max_array_size: Max element amount

  • [in] fileref: Contains the whole ddl description content. Your ddlstruct has to be included in this description.

  • [in] fileref: Reference to a file which contains the whole ddl description content. Your ddlstruct has to be included in this description.

class SystemAccessBase : public IServiceBus::ISystemAccess
#include <system_access_base.hpp>

Helper base implementation class to create a ISystemAccess implementation 3 methods to implement:

  • SystemAccessBase::createAServer

  • SystemAccessBase::createARequester

  • SystemAccessBase::getDiscoveredServices

Public Functions

virtual std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IServiceBus::IParticipantServer> createAServer(const std::string &server_name, const std::string &server_url) = 0

create the server

Return

the created server. throw if error occurs.

Parameters

  • server_name: name of the server that appear in the system

  • server_url: url of the server if necessary

virtual std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IServiceBus::IParticipantRequester> createARequester(const std::string &far_server_name, const std::string &far_server_url) const = 0

create the requester

Return

the created server. throw if error occurs.

Parameters

  • far_server_name: name of the far server that appears in the same system

  • far_server_url: url of the far server if necessary

virtual std::multimap<std::string, std::string> getDiscoveredServices(std::chrono::milliseconds timeout) const = 0

retrieves a multimap with pairs of names of the server and their addresses

Return

the multimap with pairs of names of the server and their addresses

Parameters

  • timeout: the time waiting for the discover message answers

virtual std::multimap<std::string, std::string> getCurrentlyDiscoveredServices() const = 0

retrieves a multimap with pairs of names of the curenntley discovered server and their addresses does not wait any discovery to be performed as in fep3::base::arya::SystemAccessBase::getDiscoveredServices

Return

the multimap with pairs of names of the server and their addresses

fep3::Result createServer(const std::string &server_name, const std::string &server_url)

create a server object The server itself is one access point to the service bus, where services can be registered and unregistered.

Return

if an error occurs the server object of the system access is empty

Remark

if this function is called while a server was already created before, the current server will be release. if creating of the new server fails the server object will be empty.

Parameters

  • [in] server_name: name of the server (within FEP 3 this is the participant name to appear) within one service bus instance this name has to be unique. Usually the implementation should also prevent to create a server with the same name twice within the discovery_network_url (but this depends on the used protocol if this is possible)

  • [in] server_url: address of the server:

    • for http this will be http://localhost:9090 or http://0.0.0.0:9090 to appear in all networks

    • for http this will be http://192.168.1.2:9090 to appear only in http://192.168.1.2.x networks

    • for rti dds this will be rti-dds://fep3_rpc_topic@system_name:23 to appear on domain 23 to use fep3_rpc_topic_system_name as topic on domain 23

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: successfully created

void releaseServer()

releases the server every service connection is stopped!

std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IServiceBus::IParticipantServer> getServer() const

get the participant server with the given name

Return

the server if created already

Return Value

  • empty: std::shared_ptr<IRPCServer>() no server created yet. call createServer before!

std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IServiceBus::IParticipantRequester> getRequester(const std::string &far_participant_name) const

get a requester to request service call at the participant with far_participant_name by within the system access

Remark

the participant must belong to the same system otherwise no communication is possible

Return

a requester to request messages from

Parameters

  • [in] far_participant_name: name of the far server

Return Value

  • empty: std::shared_ptr<IRPCRequester>() if far_participant_name address cannot be retrieved

std::multimap<std::string, std::string> discover(std::chrono::milliseconds timeout) const

discover servers on the given systems address and system name

Return

returns a set of server name/server address pairs

Parameters

  • [in] timeout: the timeout waiting on the discover message answers

std::string getName() const

retrieves the name of the system access (used as system_name)

Return

returns the name of the system access

std::string getUrl() const

Get the Url of the system_access.

Return

std::string the url as string

void lock()

lock creation of the server

void unlock()

unlock creation of the server

namespace detail

namespace API components where the API compatibility is NOT guaranteed.

class DataItemQueue : public DataItemQueueBase<const fep3::arya::IDataSample, const fep3::arya::IStreamType>
#include <data_item_queue.h>

Data Item queue (at the moment a locked queue) This implementation will provide a queue to read samples and types from a given index and read/pop samples and types from the front and back of the queue.

The capacity of the DataItemQueue is fixed. If samples are pushed into the queue while the queue’s capacity is reached old items are dropped.

|Nr. sample|Queue| |1. |front| |2. |2. | |.. |.. | |n. |back |

Item nr. 1 is the first item received and the front of the queue while item nr. n is the latest item received and the rear of the queue.

Public Functions

DataItemQueue(size_t capacity)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] capacity: capacity by item count of the queue (there are sample + stream type covered)

virtual ~DataItemQueue()

DTOR.

void pushSample(const data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE> &sample, fep3::arya::Timestamp time_of_receiving)

pushes a sample data read pointer to the queue

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

Parameters

  • sample: the sample data read pointer to push

  • time_of_receiving: the timestamp at which the sample was received

void pushType(const data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE> &type, fep3::arya::Timestamp time_of_receiving)

pushes a stream type data read pointer to the queue

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

Parameters

  • type: the type data read pointer to push

  • time_of_receiving: the timestamp at which the stream type was received

fep3::arya::Optional<fep3::arya::Timestamp> nextTime()

returns the timestamp of the next item available (the item at the front of the queue/the oldest item available)

Return

Optional containing the Timestamp of the queue front item

Return

Empty Optional if the queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

bool pop()

pops an item from the front of the queue (the oldest item available)

Return

true if item is popped

Return

false if the queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

bool popFront(typename DataItemQueueBase<SAMPLE_TYPE, STREAM_TYPE>::IDataItemReceiver &receiver)

pops the item from the front of the queue (the oldest item available) after putting the item to the given receiver

Return

true if item is popped

Return

false if the queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

Parameters

  • receiver: receiver reference where to call back and put the item before the item is popped.

std::tuple<data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>> popFront()

pops the item at the front of the queue (the oldest item available)

Return

{data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, nullptr} if sample item is popped

Return

{nullptr, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>} if type item is popped

Return

{nullptr, nullptr} if queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

bool popBack(typename DataItemQueueBase<SAMPLE_TYPE, STREAM_TYPE>::IDataItemReceiver &receiver)

pops the item from the back of the queue (the latest item available) after putting the item to the given receiver

Return

true if item is popped

Return

false if the queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

Parameters

  • receiver: receiver reference where to call back and put the item before the item is popped.

std::tuple<data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>> popBack()

pops the item at the back of the queue (the latest item available)

Return

{data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, nullptr} if sample item is popped

Return

{nullptr, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>} if type item is popped

Return

{nullptr, nullptr} if queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

std::tuple<data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>> read(size_t index) const

reads an item at a given index without popping it

Return

{data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, nullptr} if sample item is read

Return

{nullptr, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>} if type item is read

Return

{nullptr, nullptr} if queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

Parameters

  • index: index of the item to be read.

std::tuple<data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>> readFront()

reads the item at the front of the queue (the oldest item available) without popping it

Return

{data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, nullptr} if sample item is read

Return

{nullptr, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>} if type item is read

Return

{nullptr, nullptr} if queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

std::tuple<data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>> readBack() const

reads the item at the back of the queue (the latest item available) without popping it

Return

{data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE>, nullptr} if sample item is read

Return

{nullptr, data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE>} if type item is read

Return

{nullptr, nullptr} if queue is empty

Remark

this is thread safe against push, read and pop calls

size_t capacity() const

returns the maximum capacity of the queue

Return

maximum capacity of the queue

size_t size() const

returns the current size of the queue

Return

current size of the queue

void clear()

removes all items of the queue

QueueType getQueueType() const

returns the type of the queue

Return

QueueType the type of the queue Either QueueType::fixed or QueueType::dynamic

size_t setCapacity(size_t queue_size)

resizes the queue to an empty queue with capacity of queue_size if queue_size <= 0, the queue is resized to capacity 1

Return

size_t the new capacity

Parameters

  • queue_size: resized capacity of the queue

void reverseIteration(const std::function<bool(const data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE> &sample, const data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE> &stream_type, fep3::arya::Timestamp)> &callback) const

reverse iteration over all items stored in the queue

Parameters

  • callback: callback function will be called for each item in the queue

void iteration(const std::function<bool(const data_read_ptr<SAMPLE_TYPE> &sample, const data_read_ptr<STREAM_TYPE> &stream_type, fep3::arya::Timestamp)> &callback) const

iteration over all items stored in the queue

Parameters

  • callback: callback function will be called for each item in the queue

template<class SAMPLE_TYPE = const fep3::arya::IDataSample, class STREAM_TYPE = const fep3::arya::IStreamType>
class DataItemQueueBase
#include <data_item_queue_base.h>

Data Item queue base Base class for data item queue implementations.

Template Parameters

  • SAMPLE_TYPE: IDataRegistry::IDataSample class for samples

  • STREAM_TYPE: IStreamType class for types

  • [in] reader: the reader to remove

  • [in] writer: the writer to register

Parameters

fep3::Result addToComponents(const std::string &job_name, const std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IJob> &job, const fep3::arya::JobConfiguration &job_config, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

the job Jobs will be added to the job registry of the component.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] job_name: the job name

  • [in] job: shared pointer to a jobpointer

  • [in] job_config: configuration of the job

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

fep3::Result removeFromComponents(const std::string &job_name, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

The job with the given name will be removed from the job registry of the components.

Return

fep3::Result. If it’s an actual error, it is the error code for the job that failed last.

Parameters

  • [in] job_name: The name of the job to remove

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: The job with the given name is not registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

fep3::Result addToComponents(const std::vector<std::shared_ptr<arya::Job>> &jobs, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Jobs will be added to the job registry of the component.

If one job cannot be added, the function returns not adding the following ones.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] jobs: List of jobs to be added

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

fep3::Result removeFromComponents(const std::vector<std::string> &job_names, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Jobs will be removed from the job registry of the component.

If one job cannot be removed, the function will still try to remove the following ones within job_names.

Return

fep3::Result. If it’s an actual error, it is the error code for the job that failed last. If more than one remove fails, the error description contains a list of error descriptions separated by ‘;’.

Parameters

  • [in] job_names: List of jobs to be removed

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: A job with the given name is not registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

If one job cannot be added, the function returns not adding the following ones.

  • [in] job_registry: The job registry to add to

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

fep3::Result addToComponents(const std::vector<std::shared_ptr<arya::Job>> &jobs, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Jobs will be added to the job registry of the component.

If one job cannot be added, the function returns not adding the following ones.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] jobs: List of jobs to be added

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

fep3::Result removeJobsFromJobRegistry(const std::vector<std::string> &job_names, fep3::arya::IJobRegistry &job_registry)

Jobs will be removed from the job_registry.

If one job cannot be removed, the function will still try to remove the following ones within job_names.

Return

fep3::Result. If it’s an actual error, it is the error code for the job that failed last. If more than one remove fails, the error description contains a list of error descriptions separated by ‘;’.

Parameters

  • [in] job_names: List of jobs to be removed

  • [in] job_registry: The job registry to remove from

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: A job with the given name is not registered

fep3::Result removeFromComponents(const std::vector<std::string> &job_names, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Jobs will be removed from the job registry of the component.

If one job cannot be removed, the function will still try to remove the following ones within job_names.

Return

fep3::Result. If it’s an actual error, it is the error code for the job that failed last. If more than one remove fails, the error description contains a list of error descriptions separated by ‘;’.

Parameters

  • [in] job_names: List of jobs to be removed

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: A job with the given name is not registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

fep3::Result addToComponents(const std::string &job_name, const std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IJob> &job, const fep3::arya::JobConfiguration &job_config, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

the job Jobs will be added to the job registry of the component.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] job_name: the job name

  • [in] job: shared pointer to a jobpointer

  • [in] job_config: configuration of the job

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

Participant createParticipant(int argc, char const *const *argv, const std::string &version_info, const std::shared_ptr<const IElementFactory> &factory, std::unique_ptr<CommandLineParser> parser)

Creates a participant and parses command line arguments.

Return

Participant The created participant

Parameters

  • [in] argc: Command line argument count

  • [in] argv: Command line argument values

  • [in] parser: The parser that will be used to parse the command line arguments

  • [in] version_info: Version information of the participant to be created

  • [in] factory: factory instance which is able to create the element during load command

virtual void receiveNow(fep3::arya::Timestamp time_of_update)

will handle and receive all items from the reader queue until the given time is reached (excluding given time)

This method implements the behavior known from FEP SDK greater than or equal to version 2.3.0. Samples having a timestamp lower than the current simulation time are considered valid for the current simulation step.

Parameters

  • [in] time_of_update: samples with a timestamp lower than the time_of_update is received

virtual std::string getName() const

get name of the reader

Return

the name of the reader

class DataReaderBacklog : public ISimulationBus::IDataReceiver
#include <data_reader_backlog.h>

Reader Backlog Queue to keep the last items (capacity) until they are read.

Pop calls will empty the backlog. Read calls wont. Backlog will overwrite oldest item if capacity is full and a new item is received.

Subclassed by DataReader

Public Functions

DataReaderBacklog(size_t sample_queue_capacity, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &init_type)

CTOR for a Data Reader Backlog object.

Parameters

  • sample_queue_capacity: sample queue capacity

  • init_type: Stream Type at init time

~DataReaderBacklog()

DTOR.

Receives a stream type item.

Parameters

  • [in] type: The received stream type

void operator()(const data_read_ptr<const fep3::arya::IDataSample> &sample)

Receives a data sample item.

Parameters

  • [in] sample: The received data sample

fep3::arya::Optional<fep3::arya::Timestamp> getFrontTime()

Get the Front Time (the timestamp of the oldest item available)

Return

fep3::Optional<Timestamp>

Return Value

  • valid: time queue is not empty

  • invalid: time queue is empty

size_t getSampleQueueSize() const

retrieves the current size of the data sample backlog

Return

size_t the size as item count

retrieves the capacity of the data sample backlog

Return

size_t the capacity

  • valid: pointer the sample popped

  • invalid: pointer the queue was empty

  • invalid: pointer the queue was empty

reads the latest sample which is below an upper bound timestamp

Return

data_read_ptr<const IDataSample>

Parameters

  • upper_bound: time looking for

Return Value

  • valid: pointer the sample read

  • invalid: pointer the queue was empty or did not contain a sample with timestamp below upper_bound

Return

data_read_ptr<const IStreamType>

Return Value

  • valid: pointer the streamtype read

size_t setCapacity(size_t sample_queue_size)

resizes the data reader backlog.

This will reset the data sample queue and resize it to the given queue_size. If sample queue_size <= 0, the sample queue is resized to capacity 1

Return

size_t the new capacity

Parameters

  • sample_queue_size: resized capacity of the data sample queue

data_read_ptr<const fep3::arya::IStreamType> readTypeBefore(Timestamp) const

reads the type until upper_bound is reached

upper_bound time looking for

Return

data_read_ptr<const IStreamType>

Return Value

  • valid: pointer the streamtype read

class DataWriter
#include <data_writer.h>

Data Writer helper class to write data to a fep3::IDataRegistry::IDataWriter if registered to the fep3::IDataRegistry.

Public Functions

DataWriter()

Construct a new Data Writer with an infinite capacity queue.

Pushing or popping items from the queue increases or decreases the queue’s size. This may lead to out-of-memory situations if big numbers of items are pushed into the queue.

DataWriter(std::string name, const fep3::base::arya::StreamType &stream_type)

Construct a new Data Writer with an infinite capacity queue.

Pushing or popping items from the queue increases or decreases the queue’s size. This may lead to out-of-memory situations if big numbers of items are pushed into the queue.

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the outgoing data

  • [in] stream_type: type of the outgoing data

DataWriter(std::string name, const fep3::base::arya::StreamType &stream_type, size_t queue_capacity)

Construct a new Data Writer with a fixed capacity queue.

If the queue’s capacity is exceeded, e.g. the queue is full and more data items are pushed into the queue, old, not yet used data items are dropped.

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the outgoing data

  • [in] stream_type: type of the outgoing data

  • [in] queue_capacity: the size of the underlying data sample queue

template<typename PLAIN_RAW_TYPE>
DataWriter(std::string name)

Construct a new Data Writer with an infinite capacity queue.

Construct a new Data Writer with dynamic queue.

Pushing or popping items from the queue increases or decreases the queue’s size. This may lead to out-of-memory situations if big numbers of items are pushed into the queue.

See

fep3::base::StreamTypePlain

See

fep3::base::StreamTypePlain

  • [in] name: name of the outgoing data

Construct a new Data Writer with a fixed capacity queue.

If the queue’s capacity is exceeded, e.g. the queue is full and more data items are pushed into the queue, old, not yet used data items are dropped.

class ElementBase : public IElement, public EasyLogging
#include <element_base.h>

This is the base class for every FEP3 Element.

To implement your own FEP3 Element, derive from this class.

Subclassed by ElementConfigurable, DataJobElement< data_job_type >

Public Functions

ElementBase()

Deleted default CTOR.

virtual ~ElementBase()

Default DTOR.

virtual Result load()

Callback to load the element.

Return

Result error code

Return Value

  • NO_ERROR: if succeeded

virtual void unload()

Callback to clean up the element before unloading.

Result initialize()

Does nothing.

Return

NO_ERROR

Remark

To perform initialization of your element implementation override this method in your ElementBase’s child class. Reinitialization means that your element has already been initialized in the past and (thus e. g. memory has been allocated) now initializes again (thus e. g. there is no need to allocate memory again).

void deinitialize()

Does nothing.

Remark

To perform deinitialization of your element implementation override this method in your ElementBase’s child class. Reinitialization means that your element has already been initialized in the past and (thus e. g. memory has been allocated) now initializes again (thus e. g. there is no need to allocate memory again).

Result run()

Does nothing.

Return

NO_ERROR

Remark

To put your element into run state, override this method in your ElementBase’s child class.

void stop()

Does nothing.

Remark

To perform reinitialization of your element implementation override this method in your ElementBase’s child class. Reinitialization means that your element has already been initialized in the past and (thus e. g. memory has been allocated) now initializes again (thus e. g. there is no need to allocate memory again).

class ElementConfigurable : public ElementBase, public Configuration
#include <element_configurable.h>

This is the base class for every FEP3 Element which is able to register for properties to implement your own FEP3 Element, derive from this class.

Public Functions

ElementConfigurable()

Deleted default CTOR.

virtual ~ElementConfigurable()

Default DTOR.

class ParticipantExecutor : public ParticipantStateChanger
#include <participant_executor.hpp>

This template makes sure to execute an instance of a participant in a separate thread.

It will call the exec function asynchronously, so it is possible to continue testing. Additionally, you can send state machine change requests.

Public Functions

ParticipantExecutor(fep3::core::arya::Participant &participant)

CTOR Do not forget to call exec afterwards!

Parameters

  • participant: the participant to execute

void exec()

executor function which will call the Participant::exec function in a separated thread.

Exceptions

  • std::runtime_error: this function throws if something went wrong

~ParticipantExecutor()

DTOR.

class ParticipantStateChanger
#include <participant_state_changer.h>

helper class to change a participant’s state from system side Since the participant does not have another possibility to change the state than from service bus this testing helper will add state machine change functionality for you.

Subclassed by ParticipantExecutor

Public Functions

ParticipantStateChanger(fep3::arya::Participant &part)

CTOR.

Remark

the participants service bus will be used to obtain the participant requester

Parameters

  • [in] part: participant to manage

bool load()

sends a load request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

sends an unload request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

sends a initialize request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

bool deinitialize()

sends a deinitialize request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

sends a start request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

bool pause()

sends a pause request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

bool stop()

sends a stop request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

bool shutdown()

sends an exit request

Return

true if the request reached participant, false otherwise

namespace cpp

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace for the FEP Interface CPP.

Functions

fep3::Result removeFromComponents(const std::vector<std::shared_ptr<arya::DataJob>> &jobs, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Datajobs will be removed from the job registry of the component.

If one job cannot be removed, the function will still try to remove the following ones within job_names.

Return

fep3::Result. If it’s an actual error, it is the error code for the job that failed last. If more than one remove fails, the error description contains a list of error descriptions separated by ‘;’.

Parameters

  • [in] jobs: List of jobs to be removed

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: A job with the given name is not registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

fep3::Result addToComponents(const std::vector<std::shared_ptr<arya::DataJob>> &jobs, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Datajobs will be added to the job registry of the component.

Additionally, there data reader and writer will be registered at the DataRegistery If one job cannot be added, the function returns not adding the following ones and rolling back!

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] jobs: List of jobs to be added

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

namespace arya

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for the FEP Interface CPP introduced in version 3.0.

Functions

fep3::Result removeFromComponents(const std::vector<std::shared_ptr<arya::DataJob>> &jobs, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Datajobs will be removed from the job registry of the component.

If one job cannot be removed, the function will still try to remove the following ones within job_names.

Return

fep3::Result. If it’s an actual error, it is the error code for the job that failed last. If more than one remove fails, the error description contains a list of error descriptions separated by ‘;’.

Parameters

  • [in] jobs: List of jobs to be removed

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_NOT_FOUND: A job with the given name is not registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

fep3::Result addToComponents(const std::vector<std::shared_ptr<arya::DataJob>> &jobs, const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

Datajobs will be added to the job registry of the component.

Additionally, there data reader and writer will be registered at the DataRegistery If one job cannot be added, the function returns not adding the following ones and rolling back!

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] jobs: List of jobs to be added

  • [in] components: The component container in which the job registry will be looked up

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Everything went fine

  • ERR_RESOURCE_IN_USE: A job with the given name is already registered

  • ERR_NO_INTERFACE: The fep3::arya::IJobRegistry was not found within components

class DataJob : public Job, public Configuration, public EasyLogging
#include <datajob.h>

A DataJob will automatically register on initialization time the data to the fep::IDataRegistry It will also set up the default timing behaviour of its process method.

Public Types

using ExecuteCallback = fep3::core::arya::Job::ExecuteCallback

type of an executeion function to execute if job is triggered

Public Functions

DataJob(const std::string &name, fep3::arya::Duration cycle_time)

CTOR.

If you use this CTOR you have to override process()

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the Job

  • [in] cycle_time: Cycle time of the job (simulation time)

DataJob(const std::string &name, fep3::arya::JobConfiguration job_config)

CTOR.

If you use this CTOR you have to override process()

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the job

  • [in] job_config: default pre-configuration of the job (might be changed while runtime).

DataJob(const std::string &name, fep3::arya::Duration cycle_time, ExecuteCallback fc)

CTOR.

if using this CTOR you do NOT need to implement process(). Put your implementation into the execute function.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the Job

  • [in] fc: execute function

  • [in] cycle_time: Cycle time of the job (simulation time)

DataJob(const std::string &name, fep3::arya::JobConfiguration job_config, ExecuteCallback fc)

CTOR.

if using this CTOR you do NOT need to implement process(). Put your implementation into the execute function.

Parameters

  • [in] name: Name of the Job

  • [in] fc: execute function

  • [in] job_config: default pre-configuration of the job (might be changed while runtime).

DataReader *addDataIn(const std::string &name, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &type)

Creates a fep3::core::DataReader with a default queue capacity of 1 If you receive more than one sample before reading, these samples will be lost.

Return

created DataReader

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of signal

  • [in] type: type of signal

DataReader *addDataIn(const std::string &name, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &type, size_t queue_size)

Creates a fep3::core::DataReader with a specific queue capacity If you receive more samples than specified by queue_size before reading, these samples will be lost.

Return

created DataReader

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of signal

  • [in] type: type of signal

  • [in] queue_size: capacity of the internal DataReader item queue

DataWriter *addDataOut(const std::string &name, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &type)

Creates a fep3::core::DataWriter with a default queue capacity of 1 If you queue more than one sample before flushing these samples will be lost.

Return

created DataWriter

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of signal

  • [in] type: type of signal

DataWriter *addDataOut(const std::string &name, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &type, size_t queue_size)

Creates a fep3::core::DataWriter with a fixed maximum queue capacity.

If you queue more than queue_size samples before flushing these samples will be lost.

Return

created DataWriter

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of signal

  • [in] type: type of signal

  • [in] queue_size: maximum capacity of the queue

Exceptions

  • throws: if queue_size parameter is <= 0

DataWriter *addDynamicDataOut(const std::string &name, const fep3::arya::IStreamType &type)

Creates a fep3::core::DataWriter with infinite queue capacity.

Pushing a sample into the queue extends the queue. Every sample that is queued will be written on flush.

Return

created DataWriter

Remark

pushing big numbers of samples into the queue might lead to out-of-memory situations

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of signal

  • [in] type: type of signal

fep3::Result reconfigureDataIn(const std::string &name, size_t queue_capacity)

Resize the DataReaderBacklog of a DataReader.

Return

fep3::Result

Return

ERR_NOT_FOUND found no DataReader with the given name.

Parameters

  • [in] name: name of the DataReader to be resized.

  • [in] queue_capacity: capacity of the DataReaderBacklog after resizing.

fep3::Result addDataToComponents(const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

adds the created reader and writer to the data registry and clock

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] components: the components to add to

fep3::Result removeDataFromComponents()

remove reader and writer references to the data registry without removing the corresponding readers and writers from the data registry.

Return

fep3::Result

See

fep3::DataJob::removeDataFromComponents(const fep3::arya::IComponents& components)

fep3::Result removeDataFromComponents(const fep3::arya::IComponents &components)

remove reader and writer references to the data registry and remove the corresponding readers and writers from the data registry.

Return

fep3::Result

Parameters

  • [in] components: the components to remove from

fep3::Result reset()

The reset method to override.

implement your reset functionality here. This method is called each time before the process method is called

Return

fep3::Result If you return an error here the scheduler might stop execution immediately!

template<typename data_job_type>
class DataJobElement : public ElementBase
#include <element_base.h>

This Simple Element Type will create and add one single DataJob implementation.

Template Parameters

  • data_job_type: Type of the DataJob to add to the Element

Public Functions

DataJobElement()

CTOR.

DataJobElement(std::shared_ptr<data_job_type> job)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • job: the job which will be run cyclically

fep3::Result load()

Callback to load the element.

Return

Result error code

Return Value

  • NO_ERROR: if succeeded

void unload()

Callback to clean up the element before unloading.

void stop()

Does nothing.

Remark

To perform reinitialization of your element implementation override this method in your ElementBase’s child class. Reinitialization means that your element has already been initialized in the past and (thus e. g. memory has been allocated) now initializes again (thus e. g. there is no need to allocate memory again).

fep3::Result run()

Does nothing.

Return

NO_ERROR

Remark

To put your element into run state, override this method in your ElementBase’s child class.

namespace experimental

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace for experimental functionality which is not final yet and may likely change.

FEP 3 SDK Libraries namespace for experimental functionality which is not final yet and may likely change.

Typedefs

using SystemAggregatedHealthState = experimental::HealthState

The aggregated system health state as participant health state.

Enums

enum HealthState

Health states of a participant.

Values:

ok = 0

good health state

error = 1

participant is no longer working correctly

unknown = 2

unknown health state

ok = 0

good health state

error = 1

participant is no longer working correctly

unknown = 2

unknown health state

enum HealthState

Health states of a participant.

Values:

ok = 0

good health state

error = 1

participant is no longer working correctly

unknown = 2

unknown health state

ok = 0

good health state

error = 1

participant is no longer working correctly

unknown = 2

unknown health state

Functions

HealthState stringToHealthState(const std::string &health_state_string)

Return a health state for a given string.

The string parameter must match one of the health state names. In case of no match, the unknown state is returned.

Return

HealthState matching the provided string.

Parameters

  • health_state_string: The string to derive a health state from.

std::string healthStateToString(const HealthState &health_state)

Return the configured health state as string.

Return

The configured health state as std::string.

Parameters

  • health_state: The health state to derive a string from.

class IHealthService
#include <health_service_intf.h>

Health service interface which provides getter for current participant and system health state and functionality to set a participant to state error.

Public Functions

virtual Result setHealthToError(const std::string &message) = 0

Set the health state of this participant to state error and log the provided message.

Setting the health state to error indicates an error has occurred which prevents the participant from working correctly. The error has to be taken care of from external before the health state may be reset.

Return

Result indicating whether setting the health state succeeded or failed.

Parameters

  • message: log message indicating why the health state has been set to error.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Health state has been set successfully.

virtual Result resetHealth(const std::string &message) = 0

Reset the health state of this participant to state ok and log the provided message.

Resetting the health state to ok indicates all errors have been resolved and the participant works correctly. An error health state should only be reset to health state ok from external using rpc, not from inside the participant.

Return

Result indicating whether setting the health state succeeded or failed.

Parameters

  • message: log message indicating why the health state has been set to ok.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Health state has been set successfully.

virtual HealthState getHealth() = 0

Get the current health state of the participant.

Return

HealthState The current health state of the participant.

#include <health_service_rpc_intf.h>

definition of the external health service interface of the participant

See

health.json file

Public Functions

virtual a_util::result::Result resetHealth(const std::string &message) = 0

Reset the health state of this participant to state ok and log the provided message.

Resetting the health state to ok indicates all errors have been resolved and the participant works correctly. An error health state should only be reset to health state ok from external using rpc

Return

Result indicating whether setting the health state succeeded or failed.

Parameters

  • message: log message indicating why the health state has been set to ok.

Return Value

  • ERR_NOERROR: Health state has been set successfully.

virtual HealthState getHealth() const = 0

Get the current health state of the participant.

Return

struct SystemHealthState
#include <fep_system.h>

System health state The aggregated health state is always the highest state of the participants.

If the system health state is homogeneous, then every participant in the system has the same participant health state.

Public Functions

SystemHealthState()

CTOR.

~SystemHealthState()

DTOR.

SystemHealthState(SystemHealthState&&)

Move DTOR.

Copy DTOR.

move assignment

Return

SystemHealthState

SystemHealthState &operator=(const SystemHealthState&)

copy assignment

Return

SystemHealthState

SystemHealthState(bool homogeneous, const SystemAggregatedHealthState &system_health_state)

CTOR to set values immediately.

Parameters

  • [in] homogeneous: if the system health state is homogeneous, then every participant in the system has the same participant health state

  • [in] system_health_state: the aggregated health state is always the highest health state of the participants

SystemHealthState(const SystemAggregatedHealthState &system_health_state)

CTOR to set a homogenous health state.

Parameters

  • [in] system_health_state: the aggregated health state is always the highest health state of the participants

Public Members

bool _homogeneous

homogenous value

SystemAggregatedHealthState _system_health_state

the aggregated health state is always the highest health state of the participants

namespace legacy

this is a namespace for porting convenience this will be removed in further releases

Enums

enum Category

Category for the log.

Values:

CATEGORY_NONE = 0

any category for logging events that does not fit into any of the other

CATEGORY_SYSTEM = 1

Marks log event that occurred on system level.

There might be log events on participant category before

CATEGORY_PARTICIPANT = 2

Marks log event that occurred on participant level.

there might be log events on component or element category before

CATEGORY_COMPONENT = 3

Marks log event that occurred on component level these components are StateMachine, DataRegistry, SimulationBus.

CATEGORY_ELEMENT = 4

Marks log event that occurred on element functionality level the element category is for user level implemented within the element functionality one log may be: “ESP did only found 3 wheels, where is the fourth?” (Decide by your own which fep::logging::Severity this will be.)

class EventMonitor : public IEventMonitor
#include <event_monitor_intf.h>

Virtual class to implement FEP System Event Monitor, used with fep3::System::registerMonitoring.

Public Functions

virtual void onStateChanged(const std::string&, fep3::rpc::IRPCParticipantStateMachine::State)

legacy callback by state change.

has no effect and is not supported anymore.

virtual void onNameChanged(const std::string&, const std::string&)

legacy callback by name change.

has no effect and is not supported anymore.

virtual void onLog(std::chrono::milliseconds log_time, Category category, LoggerSeverity severity_level, const std::string &participant_name, const std::string &logger_name, const std::string &message) = 0

legacy callback on log at system, participant, component or element category.

This function will be removed in further releases. category was removed.

You will only retrieve log messages above the given fep::System::setSystemSeverityLevel

Parameters

  • [in] log_time: time of the log

  • [in] category: category of the log

  • [in] severity_level: severity level of the log

  • [in] participant_name: participant name (is empty on system category)

  • [in] logger_name: (usually the system, participant, component or element name)

  • [in] message: detailed message

void onLog(std::chrono::milliseconds log_time, LoggerSeverity severity_level, const std::string &participant_name, const std::string &logger_name, const std::string &message)

Callback on log.

You will only retrieve log messages above the given fep::System::setSystemSeverityLevel

Parameters

  • [in] log_time: time of the log

  • [in] severity_level: severity level of the log

  • [in] participant_name: participant name (is empty on system category)

  • [in] logger_name: (usually the system, participant, component or element name and category)

  • [in] message: detailed message

namespace plugin

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace for plugin related code.

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace for plugin loading mechanism.

namespace arya

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for all interfaces and public implementations introduced in version 3.0.

namespace c

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace for loading mechanism of plugins with C interface.

namespace access

namespace arya

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for all interfaces and public implementations introduced in version 3.0.

template<typename interface_type>
class ComponentBase : public fep3::plugin::c::arya::TransferableComponentBase<interface_type>, protected Helper
#include <component_base_c_access.h>

Access class for fep3::arya::IComponent Use this class to access a component that resides in another binary (e.

g. a shared library).

Note

IComponent is expected to be a base class for a “specific interface”.

Template Parameters

  • interface_type: The type of the specific component interface, that is derived from IComponent

fep3::Result initialize()

Initializes a component.

Return

fep3::Result

fep3::Result tense()

Gets the component ready for running state.

Return

fep3::Result

fep3::Result relax()

Makes the component falling back to a simple initialized state Relax is the antonym of tense.

Return

fep3::Result

fep3::Result start()

Starts the component.

Return

fep3::Result

fep3::Result stop()

Stops the component.

Return

fep3::Result

fep3::Result deinitialize()

Deinitializes the component.

Return

fep3::Result

fep3::Result create()

create the base component.

if this create method is called the _components pointer is valid already

Return

Result

fep3::Result destroy()

destroy the base component.

if this destroy method is called the _components pointer is still valid

Return

Result

Calls createComponent on the remote object and stores the passed components.

fep3::Result

  • [in] components: Weak pointer to the components

Return

this Components

Deleted copy assignment.

Return

this Components

~Components()

Default DTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] fep_iid: the component interface identifier to retrieve.

Return Value

  • nullptr: if not found

class Destructor : public IDestructor
#include <destructor_c_access.h>

Class calling destroy(…) on a C access structure of access_type Use this class to automatically destroy a remote object when the instance of this class is destroyed.

Pre

access_type must have fields “destroy” and “_handle”

Template Parameters

  • access_type: Type of the C access structure

Public Functions

Destructor(const access_type &access)

CTOR.

Parameters

  • [in] access: C access structure to call destroy on upon destruction

virtual ~Destructor()

DTOR calling destroy(…) on the C access structure.

CTOR.

Return

Error information as string

class Helper
#include <c_access_helper.h>

Access helper to access a remote object from within C++ through a binary boundary.

The (static) methods of this class provide facilities to write an access class for a C++ interface by one single statement per access class method. Example: For a C++ interface to be wrapped: class IMyStuff { public: virtual ~IMyStuff() = default; virtual int32_t getValue() const = 0; }; The access class looks like this when using the Helper class: class AccessToIMyStuff : public IMyStuff , private fep3::plugin::c::access::arya::Helper { public: /// Type of C access structure using Access = SIMyStuff; AccessToIMyStuff(Access&& access); ~AccessToIMyStuff() override = default; // methods implementing IMyStuff virtual int32_t getValue() const override { // using the Helper class the method implementation can be done in one single statement return callWithResultParameter(_access._handle, _access.getValue); } private: Access _access; };

Subclassed by ComponentBase< fep3::arya::IClockService >, ComponentBase< fep3::arya::IJobRegistry >, ComponentBase< fep3::arya::ISimulationBus >, ComponentBase<::fep3::arya::IConfigurationService >, ComponentBase<::fep3::arya::IParticipantInfo >, ComponentBase<::fep3::arya::ISchedulerService >, Clock, ComponentBase< interface_type >, Components, DataSample, Job, RawMemory, Scheduler

namespace arya

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for all interfaces and public implementations introduced in version 3.0.

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for loading mechanism of plugins with C interface introduced in version 3.0.

class DestructionManager
#include <destruction_manager.h>

Class managing the destruction of objects.

Subclassed by Clock, Clock::EventSink, Components, DataSample, Job, Properties< access_type >, RawMemory, Scheduler, SimulationBus::DataReader, SimulationBus::DataReceiver, SimulationBus::DataWriter, TransferableComponentBase< interface_type >, Properties< fep3_arya_const_SIProperties >, TransferableComponentBase< ::fep3::arya::IConfigurationService >, TransferableComponentBase< ::fep3::arya::IParticipantInfo >, TransferableComponentBase< ::fep3::arya::ISchedulerService >, TransferableComponentBase< fep3::arya::IClockService >, TransferableComponentBase< fep3::arya::IJobRegistry >, TransferableComponentBase< fep3::arya::ISimulationBus >

Public Functions

DestructionManager()

Default CTOR.

DestructionManager(const DestructionManager&)

Copy CTOR.

Note

Does not copy the queue of destructors of the object to copy from, because it is strictly bound to the latter

DestructionManager(DestructionManager&&)

Move CTOR.

Note

Does not move the queue of destructors of the object to copy from, because it is strictly bound to the latter

DestructionManager &operator=(const DestructionManager&)

Copy assignment.

Note

Does not copy the queue of destructors of the object to copy from, because it is strictly bound to the latter

Return

Reference to this

DestructionManager &operator=(DestructionManager&&)

Move assignment.

Note

Does not copy the queue of destructors of the object to copy from, because it is strictly bound to the latter

Return

Reference to this

virtual ~DestructionManager()

DTOR.
