class IDestructor
#include <destructor_intf.h>

Interface for a destructor object.

Subclassed by Destructor< access_type >, OtherDestructor< other_type >

class ISharedBinary
#include <shared_binary_intf.h>

Interface for shared binary A shared binary implements shared ownership to a binary, e.

g. a dynamically loaded shared library (aka plugin). As long as the shared binary exists, the underlying resource, e. g. the library, must not be unloaded. To ensure that a resource (e. g. a library) is not unloaded while any object exists that resides in the resource (i. e. was created in the memory space of the resource), just retain a copy of the shared binary alongside with every such object.

Subclassed by SharedBinary

Public Functions

virtual ~ISharedBinary()

DTOR.

template<typename other_type>
class OtherDestructor : public IDestructor
#include <destruction_manager.h>

Class deleting another object upon destruction.

Template Parameters

  • other_type: The type of the other object

Public Functions

OtherDestructor(other_type *pointer_to_other)

CTOR Constructs an object that will delete the object behind pointer_to_other upon destruction of this.

Parameters

  • [in] pointer_to_other: The pointer to the other object to be deleted

~OtherDestructor()

DTOR Deletes the object behind the pointer as passed to the constructor.

template<typename interface_type>
class TransferableComponentBase : public Component<interface_type>, public SharedBinaryManager, public DestructionManager
#include <transferable_component_base.h>

  • interface_type: The type of the interface to be transferred

Subclassed by ComponentBase< interface_type >

Public Functions

TransferableComponentBase()

Default CTOR.

TransferableComponentBase(const std::shared_ptr<fep3::plugin::c::arya::IComponentGetter> &component_getter)

CTOR taking deductors for the type deduction of the component access types.

Parameters

  • [in] component_getter: The component getter providing access to other components

TransferableComponentBase(TransferableComponentBase&&)

Deleted move CTOR.

TransferableComponentBase(const TransferableComponentBase&)

Deleted copy CTOR.

TransferableComponentBase &operator=(TransferableComponentBase&&)

Deleted move assignment.

Return

this TransferableComponentBase

TransferableComponentBase &operator=(const TransferableComponentBase&)

Deleted copy assignment.

Return

this TransferableComponentBase

virtual ~TransferableComponentBase()

Default DTOR.

inline fep3::Result createComponent(const std::weak_ptr<const fep3::arya::IComponents> &components)

Creates a component and sets up access to remote components.

Return

FEP Result

Parameters

  • [in] components: Weak pointer to all components to setup access for

namespace wrapper

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace code wrapping objects in a C interface.

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library namespace for wrapping objects in a C interface.

namespace arya

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for all interfaces and public implementations introduced in version 3.0.

FEP 3 SDK Participant Library version namespace for wrapping objects in a C interface introduced in version 3.0.

Functions

fep3_SResult getResult(const fep3::Result &result)

Helper function for result conversion from fep3::Result to fep3_SResult.

Return

The converted result

Parameters

  • [in] result: The result to be converted to fep3_SResult

template<typename clock_service_type>
fep3_plugin_c_InterfaceError createClockService(fep3_arya_SIClockService *result, const fep3_plugin_c_arya_SISharedBinary &shared_binary_access, const char *iid)

Creates a clock service object of type clock_service_type.

Return

Interface error code

Template Parameters

  • clock_service_type: The type of the clock service object to be created

Parameters

  • [inout] result: Pointer to the access structure to the created clock service object

  • [in] shared_binary_access: Access structure to the shared binary the clock service object resides in

  • [in] iid: The interface ID of the clock service interface of the created object

Return Value

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_none: No error occurred

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_result_pointer: The result is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_exception_caught: An exception has been thrown while creating the component

  • [in] iid: The interface ID of the simulation bus interface of the created object

template<typename factory_type, typename result_type, typename access_creator_type, typename ...argument_types>
fep3_plugin_c_InterfaceError create(factory_type &&factory, result_type *result, const fep3_plugin_c_arya_SISharedBinary &shared_binary_access, access_creator_type &&access_creator, argument_types&&... arguments)

Creates a new object using the passed factory by passing the arguments to the latter.

The pointer to the newly created object is used to create a C access structure via access_creator which is then written to result.

Note

The C access structure as written to result takes ownership of the object. This method can be used to create an object and return a C access structure for it over a C interface.

Return

Interface error code

Template Parameters

  • object_type: The type of the object to be created

  • result_type: The type of result to write the C access structure to

  • access_creator_type: The type of the access creator to be used to create the C access structure

  • argument_types: Parameter pack holding all parameters to be passed to the method

Parameters

  • [out] factory: Callable factory capable to create an object

  • [out] result: Pointer to the result to write the C access structure to

  • [in] shared_binary_access: C access structure for the shared binary the caller resides in

  • [out] access_creator: The callable that creates the C access structure for the created object

  • [in] arguments: The arguments to be passed to the constructor of object_type

Return Value

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_none: No error occurred

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_handle: The handle is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_result_pointer: The access_result is null

template<typename interface_type, typename object_type, typename interface_handle_type, typename result_type, typename access_creator_type>
fep3_plugin_c_InterfaceError get(result_type *access_result, const interface_handle_type &interface_handle, access_creator_type &&access_creator)

Gets access to an object as identified by interface_handle.

This method can be used to get an object and return a C access structure for it over a C interface.

Return

Interface error code

Template Parameters

  • interace_type: The type of the interface of the object as identified by interface_handle

  • object_type: The type of the object to get

  • result_type: The type of result to write the C access structure to

  • access_creator_type: The type of the access creator to be used to create the C access structure

Parameters

  • [out] access_result: Pointer to the result to write the C access structure to

  • [in] interface_handle: Handle to the interface of the object to get

  • [in] access_creator: The callable that creates the C access structure for the object to get

Return Value

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_none: No error occurred

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_handle: The handle is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_result_pointer: The access_result is null

class Component : private Helper<fep3::arya::IComponent>

static fep3_plugin_c_InterfaceError createComponent(Handle handle, fep3_result_callback_type result_callback, void *result_destination, fep3_plugin_c_arya_SDestructionManager *destruction_manager_access_result, fep3_arya_SComponents components_access, fep3_plugin_c_arya_HComponentGetterFunctionGetters handle_to_component_getter_function_getters, fep3_plugin_c_arya_SDestructionManager component_getter_function_getters_destruction_manager_access)

Calls fep3::arya::IComponent::createComponent on the object identified by handle.

Return

Interface error code

Parameters

  • [in] handle: The handle to the component object to call fep3::arya::IComponent::createComponent on

  • [in] result_callback: Callback to pass the result of the call of fep3::arya::IComponent::createComponent on the component object to

  • [in] result_destination: Destination for the result to be passed to the result_callback

  • [in] destruction_manager_access_result: Pointer to the result of a destruction manager access for the remote object

  • [in] components_access: Access to components

  • [in] handle_to_component_getter_function_getters: Handle to the component getter function getters

  • [in] component_getter_function_getters_destruction_manager_access: Access to the destruction manager for the component getter function getters

Return Value

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_none: No error occurred

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_handle: The handle is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_exception_caught: An exception has been thrown from within fep3::arya::IComponent::createComponent

Parameters

  • [in] handle: The handle to the object to call fep3::arya::IDataSample::read on

  • [in] result: Pointer to the result of the call of fep3::arya::IDataSample::read

  • [in] raw_memory_access: The access structure to the raw memory to be passed

Return Value

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_none: No error occurred

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_handle: The handle is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_result_pointer: The result is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_exception_caught: An exception has been thrown from within fep3::arya::IDataSample::read

struct AccessCreator
#include <data_sample_c_access_wrapper.h>

Functor creating an access structure for fep3::arya::IClock::IEventSink.

Parameters

class Destructor
#include <destructor_c_wrapper.h>

Wrapper class for destruction of an object through a C interface.

Public Static Functions

static void destroy(fep3_plugin_c_arya_HDestructionManager handle)

Destroys the object identified by handle.

Parameters

  • [in] handle: The handle identifying the object to be destroyed

template<typename interface_type>
class Helper
#include <c_wrapper_helper.h>

Wrapper helper to transfer function calls on a C interface to the corresponding C++ object identified by a handle.

The (static) methods of this class provide facilities to write a wrapper class for a C interface by one single statement per wrapper class method. Example: For a C++ interface to be wrapped: class IMyStuff { public: virtual ~IMyStuff() = default; virtual int32_t getValue() const = 0; }; The access class looks like this when using the Helper class: class WrapperOfIMyStuff : private fep3::plugin::c::wrapper::arya::Helper<IMyStuff> { private: using Handle = HIMyStuff; public: // static methods transferring calls from the C interface to an object of IMyStuff static inline fep3_plugin_c_InterfaceError getValue(Handle handle, int32_t* result) noexcept { return callWithResultParameter (handle , &IMyStuff::get , [](int32_t result) { return result; } , result ); } };

#include <job_c_access_wrapper.h>

Public Static Functions

static fep3_plugin_c_InterfaceError setProperty(handle_type handle, bool *result, const char *name, const char *value, const char *type)

Calls fep3::arya::IProperties::setProperty on the object identified by handle.

Return

Interface error code

Parameters

  • [in] handle: The handle to the properties object to call fep3::arya::IProperties::setProperty on

  • [out] result: Pointer to the result of the call of fep3::arya::IProperties::setProperty on the property object

  • [in] name: The name of the property to set

  • [in] value: The value of the property to set

  • [in] type: The type of the property to set

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_none: No error occurred

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_handle: The handle is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_result_pointer: The result is null

Return

Interface error code

Parameters

  • [in] callback: Pointer to callback function to be called with the property value string as returned by the call to fep3::arya::IProperties::getProperty on the property object

  • [in] destination: Pointer to the destination to be passed to the callback

  • [in] name: The name of the property to get the value of

Return Value

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_none: No error occurred

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_invalid_handle: The handle is null

  • fep3_plugin_c_interface_error_exception_caught: An exception has been thrown from within fep3::arya::IProperties::getProperty

namespace detail

FEP 3 SDK namespace for helper and implementation utilities.

Do not directly use them in your code!

namespace cpp
namespace arya
template<class component_impl_type>
class CPPPluginComponentFactory : public ICPPPluginComponentFactory
#include <cpp_plugin_component_factory.h>

CPP plugin Component factory helper template to create one instance of the implementation component_impl_type.

Template Parameters

  • component_impl_type: the implementation type

class ICPPPluginComponentFactory
#include <cpp_plugin_component_factory_intf.h>

The ICPPPluginComponentFactory interface must be provided by a cpp-plugin.

Subclassed by CPPPluginComponentFactory< component_impl_type >

Public Functions

virtual ~ICPPPluginComponentFactory()

DTOR.

virtual std::unique_ptr<fep3::arya::IComponent> createComponent(const std::string &component_iid) const = 0

creates and returns one instance of the given component_iid (component interface identifier).

Return

std::unique_ptr<IComponent> valid component instance for the component_iid (component interface identifier).

Parameters

  • [in] component_iid: component interface identifier

Return Value

  • std::unique_ptr<IComponent>(): empty if not created

namespace rpc

FEP 3 SDK Libraries namespace for rpc functionality (remote procedure call)

namespace arya

FEP 3 SDK Libraries version namespace for rpc functionality (remote procedure call) version 3.0.

Enums

enum ParticipantState

Participant State.

Values:

undefined

This state is used if a participant has no StateMachine or is not reachable (maybe shut down)

unreachable

This state is used if a state machine was detected before, but currently the state cannot be obtained (no answer)

unloaded

valid unloaded state

loaded

valid loaded state

initialized

valid initialized state

paused

valid paused state

running

valid running state

Functions

template<class T>
std::string getRPCIID()

retrieve rpc interface identifier information from type T

Return

std::string the rpc identifier of the type

Template Parameters

  • T: the type that must define an interface identifier via FEP_RPC_IID

template<class T>
std::string getRPCDefaultName()

retrieves the default name of this RPC object this will be the default name to register to the RPC Service Registry/RPC Server (see fep3::arya::IRPCServer)

Return

std::string

Template Parameters

  • T: the type that must define an interface identifier via FEP_RPC_IID

class IRPCClockService : public IRPCClockServiceDef
#include <clock_service_rpc_intf.h>

definition of the external clock service interface of the participant

See

clock.json file

Public Types

enum ClockType

Type of the clock.

Values:

invalid = -1

invalid type

continuous_clock = 0

continues clock (or steady)

discrete_clock = 1

discrete clock with discrete steps

Public Functions

virtual std::vector<std::string> getClockNames() const = 0

retrieves the list of the names of all registered clocks of the corresponding participant

Return

comma separated list of the names of all registered clocks

virtual std::string getMainClockName() const = 0

retrieves the names of the current main clock configured out of the registered clock names

Return

the name of all main clock

virtual int64_t getTime(const std::string &clock_name) const = 0

get time in nano sec for the given clock if clock_name is empty it will return the time of the current getMainClockName

Return

value of the time in nano sec resolution

Parameters

  • [in] clock_name: name of the clock to retrieve the current time from

Return Value

  • -1: if the clock does not exist

virtual ClockType getType(const std::string &clock_name) const = 0

get the type in for the given clock if clock_name is empty it will return the type of the current getMainClockName

Return

value of the type

Parameters

  • [in] clock_name: name of the clock to retrieve the current type from

Return Value

  • ClockType::invalid: if the clock does not exist

delivered clock_service.json file

definition of the FEP rpc service iid for the clock service

class IRPCClockSyncMasterDef
#include <clock_sync_service_rpc_intf_def.h>

definition of the external service interface of the clock service as clock master

See

delivered clock_sync_master.json file

Public Types

enum EventID

definition of the rpc propagated time events

Values:

time_update_before = 1

time update before

See

fep3::arya::IClock::IEventSink::timeUpdateBegin

time_updating = 2

time updating

See

fep3::arya::IClock::IEventSink::timeUpdating

time_update_after = 3

time update after

See

fep3::arya::IClock::IEventSink::timeUpdateEnd

time_reset = 4

time reset

See

fep3::arya::IClock::IEventSink::timeResetEnd

enum EventIDFlag

definition of the rpc propagated time events registration by default only register_for_time_updating and register_for_time_reset is used.

Values:

register_for_time_update_before = 0x01

register to get a IRPCClockSyncMasterDef::EventID::time_update_before event

register_for_time_updating = 0x02

register to get a IRPCClockSyncMasterDef::EventID::time_updating event

register_for_time_update_after = 0x04

register to get a IRPCClockSyncMasterDef::EventID::time_update_after event

register_for_time_reset = 0x08

register to get a IRPCClockSyncMasterDef::EventID::time_reset event

Public Functions

FEP_RPC_IID("clock_sync_master.arya.fep3.iid", "clock_sync_master")

definition of the FEP rpc service iid for a clock synchronization master

class IRPCClockSyncSlaveDef
#include <clock_sync_service_rpc_intf_def.h>

class IRPCConfiguration : public IRPCConfigurationDef
#include <configuration_rpc_intf.h>

definition of the external service interface for the participants configuration You will be able to set and get properties.

See

configuration.json file

Public Functions

virtual std::shared_ptr<IProperties> getProperties(const std::string &property_path) = 0

retrieve the instance of one properties node within the tree.

to retrieve root use "/" or “” (empty) string.

Return

returns a connection to the IProperties node.

Parameters

  • [in] property_path: path to the properties

Exceptions

  • If: the connection has a timeout it will throw a runtime error

virtual std::shared_ptr<const IProperties> getProperties(const std::string &property_path) const = 0

retrieve the const instance of one properties node within the tree.

to retrieve root use "/" or “” (empty) string.

If the connection has a timeout it will throw a runtime error.

Parameters

  • [in] property_path: path to the properties

Return

returns a connection to the IProperties node.

Return Value

  • empty_shared_ptr: property does not exist

class IRPCDataRegistry : public IRPCDataRegistryDef
#include <data_registry_rpc_intf.h>

definition of the external service interface of the data registry

See

data_registry.json file

Public Functions

virtual std::vector<std::string> getSignalsIn() const = 0

Get a list of the signal names going in.

Remark

Since this information is retrieved with the FEP 2 Signal Registry and the FEP Developer may register its Signal while initializing state a reliable return value is only possible while state ready has been reached.

Return

std::vector<std::string> signal list names

virtual std::vector<std::string> getSignalsOut() const = 0

Get a list of the signal names going out.

Remark

Since this information is retrieved with the FEP 2 Signal Registry and the FEP Developer may register its Signal while initializing state a reliable return value is only possible while state ready has been reached.

Return

std::vector<std::string> signal list names

virtual std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IStreamType> getStreamType(const std::string &signal_name) const = 0

Get the Stream Type for the given signal name.

Return

std::shared_ptr<fep3::arya::IStreamType> The current stream type valid for the signal

Parameters

  • [in] signal_name: The signal name

class IRPCLoggingService : public IRPCLoggingServiceDef
#include <logging_rpc_intf.h>

definition of the external service interface for the logging service You will be register logging listeners and set configurations.

See

logging_service.json file

Public Functions

virtual bool setLoggerFilter(const std::string &logger_name, const LoggerFilter &configuration) const = 0

Sets the configuration for a given logger (domain)

Return

true if the configuration is successful, false otherwise

Parameters

  • [in] logger_name: The logger name / domain to be configured

  • [in] configuration: A POD object that holds the configuration settings

virtual LoggerFilter getLoggerFilter(const std::string &logger_name) const = 0

gets the configuration for a given logger (domain)

Return

returns the configured logger filter if found. otherwise it is empty.

Parameters

  • [in] logger_name: The logger name / domain to get the current set filter for

virtual std::vector<std::string> getLoggers() const = 0

gets a list of the available loggers

Return

returns a list of the available loggers

virtual std::vector<std::string> getSinks() const = 0

gets a list of the current available sinks

Return

returns a list of the current available sinks

virtual std::shared_ptr<IProperties> getProperties(const std::string &sink_name) const = 0

get the properties of the given sink.

Return

returns the properties of the sink

Parameters

  • [in] sink_name: name of the sink

class IRPCLoggingSinkService : public IRPCLoggingSinkServiceDef
#include <logging_rpc_intf.h>

The RPC Logging Sink Service interface provide functionality to register and unregister a server address where the log messages can be sent to.

Public Functions

virtual int registerRPCClient(const std::string &url) = 0

registers the address at the service to receive messages

Return

returns 0 if succeeded

Parameters

  • [in] url: valid url to send the log messages to

virtual int unregisterRPCClient(const std::string &url) = 0

unregisters the address from the service to stop sending log messages to that address

Return

returns 0 if succeeded

Parameters

  • [in] url: valid url where the messages were sent to

Return

std::string the name

  • runtime_error: if timeout occurred

Return

std::string the system name

Remark

this is not yet implemented

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: if timeout occurred

get the names of all registered rpc component object within the participant

Return

std::vector<std::string> the list of the names

  • runtime_error: if timeout occurred

virtual std::vector<std::string> getRPCComponentIIDs(const std::string &rpc_component_name) const = 0

get the identifier of all interfaces the rpc component object supports

Return

std::vector<std::string> the list of the rpc interface identifiers

Parameters

  • [in] rpc_component_name: the component name to retrieve the interface ids from

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: if timeout occurred

virtual std::string getRPCComponentInterfaceDefinition(const std::string &rpc_component_name, const std::string &rpc_component_iid) const = 0

gets the fully interface definition of the interface of the rpc component

Return

std::string the interface definition as string

Parameters

  • [in] rpc_component_name: the component name to get the interface definition from

  • [in] rpc_component_iid: the interface id to get the interface definition of

Exceptions

  • runtime_error: if timeout occurred

See

Public Functions

virtual State getState() const = 0

Get the state of the participant.

Return

see State

virtual void load() = 0

sends a load event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

virtual void unload() = 0

sends an unload event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

virtual void initialize() = 0

sends an initialize event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

virtual void deinitialize() = 0

sends a deinitialize event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

virtual void start() = 0

sends a start event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

virtual void pause() = 0

sends a pause event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

virtual void stop() = 0

sends a stop event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

virtual void shutdown() = 0

sends a shutdown event to the participants state machine

Exceptions

  • logical_error: if the event is invalid

template<typename server_stub, typename rpc_interface>
class RPCService : protected rpc::jsonrpc_object_server<server_stub, arya::detail::JSONFEPServerConnector>, public IRPCServer::IRPCService
#include <fep_rpc_stubs_service.h>

Parent class of all rpc servers.

Template Parameters

  • ServerStub: Generated server stub.

  • Interface: Server id interface.

Public Functions

no_documentation std::string getRPCServiceIIDs() const

get the service id

Return Value

  • service: ID.

std::string getRPCInterfaceDefinition() const

get the interface definition

Return Value

  • interface: definition

template<typename rpc_stub, typename rpc_interface>

  • Interface: Server id interface.

Return Value

namespace experimental
class IRPCPassthrough
#include <rpc_passthrough_intf.h>

definition of the a rpc passthrough service which gives direct access to the rpc methods of another service.

Public Functions

FEP_RPC_IID("rpc_passthrough.experimental.rpc.fep3.iid", "rpc_passthrough")

definition of the FEP rpc service iid of the rpc passthrough service

virtual bool call(const std::string &request, std::string &response) = 0

passthrough the json rpc request directly to the service

Parameters

  • [in] request: Request string from json rpc

  • [out] response: Result of rpc call as json rpc string

Return Value

  • true: if everything works fine
